Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again over the St Patrick's Day weekend. Our son attends Columbia College, so this is an ideal place to stay when we visit him. The Blackstone is a cool 1890's-era hotel on Michigan Avenue. We've stayed only in the lake-view rooms (worth the upgrade) and have only nice things to say about the rooms, the cleanliness, the attentiveness of staff, and the overall ambience. The bathrooms are large, well-appointed, and luxurious with marble floors and very nice fixtures. Everything in the hotel is clean and bright. The mattresses are very comfortable. There's no sound between floors, and very little between rooms. The lobby & hallways are nicely-appointed and comfortable. For the price, this is a very nice hotel, and comes highly-recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best renovation ever”
Reviews.Author: Synchro12
Reviews.Content: I once stayed ay the blackstone hotel in the 1990s, back when it was a run- down palace of past-gone glories, back when you could stay a night with 7 other grad students in a single room, back when the heating and cooling systems barely worked. But thankfully those days are long gone and the Blackstone has been restored to it's former grandeur. Now it is elegant, clean, and comfortable. Rooms are large, lake views are still fabulous and I can't imagine staying anywhere else in the loop. I wish every hotel I had to stay in was as comfortable as this. The tapas bar on the first floor is a bot pricey but absolutely delish. You probably wouldn't want to eat there more than one night. Starbucks on the bottom floor make breakfast easy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: HershieK
Reviews.Content: True to previous reviews, the staff here are always friendly and helpful! We were looking at colleges with our 18 year old daughter and I hoped to share all of the Chicago experience with her while we were in town. The location is two minutes from Lake Shore Drive, Highway access and 5 miutes from Navy Pier, Water Tower, Downtown! Gorgeous hotel decor, mixed turn of the century with modern. Valet parking is expensive but it is at all the hotels. My husband parked on the corner and payed a meter. Not my first choice but it made him happy! ACCOMMODATIONS: We had a concierge room on the 20th floor with a full view of Lake Michigan. Our room was clean and comfortable with chocolates and water bottles left on our pillow everynight. The attendants were kind and friendly but always seemed to forget that there were three of us in our room. Not a big deal though, just a mention. Beds were comfortable and Queen size not full!! Thank YOU!! Not two doubles! Rooms was quiet from street noise which was a huge plus! One complaint about room, the bathroom door. It is a sliding door and never stayed on it's track, plus you could see in about an inch space of the side of the slider so my husband/daughter had to be careful to maintain privacy when in the bath room. Inside the bathroom we had nice counter space and a marble shower. Clean, towels were kind of small. Towels are the "scrubby" kind of towels which I like because they get the blood circulating. I have heard reviewers complain they were not soft enough but it is not because they are bad towels, just a different style. CONCIERGE LOUNGE: LOVE THE DESIGN and decor of the lounge, great place for a "chat" and to sip coffee or read a newspaper. CON-Food was really bad, bad, bad! They have water bottles and soda in the mini fridges. We preferred getting our coffee at the Starbucks below the lobby of the hotel. WORKOUT ROOM:The workout room had newer equipment in excellent shape and overlooks Grant Park and Lake Michigan. I would rate the workout facility slightly above average. Definitely had what we needed for a full workout but nothing over the top. Towels and water were provided, one water had fresh lemons and ice! My only complaint about the workout facility was that the equipment was kind of dusty, not really dirty, but it did not look as though they have anyone assigned to clean the equipment on a regular basis. In addition, finding the remotes to turn the tv volume down was somedays a workout in itself! ha RESTAURANT: They have a Spanish/Tapas style restaurant in the hotel but we did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Touches of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: medicalalert
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this luxurious, historic property. Rooms appear to have been recently rennovated, with comfortable, upscale touches - television embedded in the bathroon mirror, very comfortable leather chair for relaxing, high-end bedding, and a very productive work area. Although I coudl hear the train behind the property, it never interferred with sleep or work. I also never heard a sound from the other rooms around me despite the fact that the hotel was full. Starbucks on the lower level along with a great Spanish Tappas restaurant ( Iron Chef Jose Garces). Property is very close to Soldier Field and the Natural History Museum. There's also a very well equipped Gym on the 6th floor with new cardio equipment, free weights and lots of floor space for other activities - great spot to see the sun rise over the lake! I'm looking forward to spring when I definitely plan to return with my wife for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I travel 100+ nights a year and have stayed at most of the major hotels in Downtown Chicago over the years and this was by far the best I've ever had and one of the best anywhere. The hotel is beautiful and very stylish my room was terrific. Huge, well-lighted marble bath; comfy bed; gigantic room with sitting area; very quiet; and great service. I ordered room service three times and it was delicious. Looking forward to my next trip to Chicago to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPT
Reviews.Content: Booked this for a fun weekend outing with the hubby. We loved it. The hotel was newly renovated in a modern hipster decor and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krista K
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful and rooms were very nicely decorated. We were able to get a great rate by booking on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Wow -- I loved it”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: A historic hotel with beautiful lobby and ultra modern, almost W-like, rooms. My room was relatively small but completely comfortable with 3 big windows and a view of the Lake. It had a desk with a pull-out section, almost doubling its size. The bed was very comfortable; temperature control was perfect. The bathroom, with dark navy (or black) walls had a double sink, a large walk-in shower, and great lighting -- lots of chrome and glass. Everything worked perfectly; there were lots of surfaces; and easily accessible outlets everywhere. I needed to grab food on the go, and ended up crossing the street to the Hilton for that. The Starbucks in the hotel had a very long line every time I checked it out, and no other please to grad something. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Large Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mcap56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Most of my colleagues stayed at one of the other nearby hotels and most complained about small/old rooms. The rooms at this hotel are clean, well appointed, comfortable, quiet and HUGE! The beds are very comfortable as well. The best views are in rooms facing Michigan Avenue. There will be a little street noise there however. Rooms facing the back have decent views and the corner rooms are particularly large but the trains pass by just a few blocks away and they can be loud. Side facing rooms are quieter (I had one) but less scenic. The gym is very well equiped and free. The staff is very friendly. One minor gripe, you have to pay for internet service but there seems to be no esacping that at any of the higher priced hotels there days. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendou Quality (Hotel and Staff)”
Reviews.Author: ablux28
Reviews.Content: Do not have enough words to describe the experience at this hotel. Had a short stay there (my mistake) and was gladly surprised with the amenities, room, etc. But wat really blew my mind was the staff, all of them extremely helpful and willing to make you feel you were an important guest. And to top it up, I had an issue with an ebay purchase that arrived after I left and their Mail Service was totally helpful in assisting me with getting it sent to another location. I will most likely return to Chicago and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Nice rooms and a fantastic Gym, Brilliant Lobby and just a generally nice hotel. terrible view however would reccomend asking for a Lake view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for events!”
Reviews.Author: thefranki
Reviews.Content: I stayed for New Years Eve for a wedding hosted in the ballroom. First, I was amazed at the cost of the rooms; what a deal for downtown! We took the train in from Midway and it was just a short walk. We were excited that our room was ready for an early check in. The rooms were well decorated; my only critique was that there was no bath tub, but the big walkin rain shower was nice. The rooms had some great books about the city, I think my husband read them all during our 2 night stay. As for the event, I was blown away a how gorgeous everything was and how well organized it was. Ceremony and reception were in the ballroom - you really just need to see it if you are there. There was cocktails on the art floor, which had a very cool vibe. I just loved the history of the building. Will definitely stay there when we come back in baseball season to cheer on he cubs.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: mrspmc00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Blackstone before and had a great time - but never thought of it with our kids. We found ourselves going downtown for the Chicago Cubs Convention at the hotel across the street from the Blackstone. Being that we are Marriott elite members, the Blackstone was an obvious choice...but would it be ok for the kids? I called the hotel directly and chatted with Tina (she is wonderful!) and made the reservation. We asked for early check in since we would be arriving in the morning for the convention. I intended just to drop our bags with the bellman and head across the street. When we arrived at 8 am, we were told they had a room ready for us!!! Really??? Amazing!!!! We headed up to our room - it was on Club level - and were thrilled with the size for the 4 of us! It was a really big room for such an old building - much bigger than the other rooms in the hotel we have been in. We returned after a full day at the convention and were warmly welcomed back by the doorman - he made a point to talk to my daughters. They thought that was the best thing ever! Little things like that make all the difference! We had one issue - at about 2 am the room next to us decided to have a REALLY loud party. Loud to the point our wall was rattling from the music and LOUD people. A quick, polite call down to the front desk had the issue settled within 20 minutes, and we all went back to sleep. Not the greatest experience in the world, but it was certainly not the hotel's fault, and they handled it quickly!!! We will be back to our wonderful Blackstone this summer, and we will definitely be back for next year's Cubs Convention!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: tbrennan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight while attending a work function. They hotel offered us a great rate. The location is great right on Michigan ave. The rooms were very clean and nice. the bed and linens were great, the bathrooms with Kohler fixtures and rain shower were great (5 star). The elevator lobbies on the floors were nice. The only thing that would need updating would be the lobby. Too much black. You are greeted by friendly doormen and as you enter the lobby there is a circular couch that they should do away with and the check in desks are off to the left and don't stand out. Valet parking was a bit steep $53.00 overnight (1 time charge - use your car as much as you like) when public overnight parking was $33.00.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Livy M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blackstone for New Years with some friends. We spent 3 nights there. I have stayed at many Marriotts, JW's and Renaissance hotels and this is one is definitely one of my favorites, with the Eden Roc in Miami ranking at the top of my list. I loved the modern decor. The marble in the room, the glasses, the comfy chair added great touches. I only had a few minor issues with The Blackstone. The first was that we couldn't get an upgrade to a lakeview room and had a pretty horrible view of the subway behind the hotel. They were nice enough to give my sister and I two rooms right next to each other, but my room was clearly bigger and had room for the comfy chair. My sister's room did not and she also had a sliding bathroom door which many people complained about, but she loved it. My next issue with The Blackstone is the towels. The quality was not that great. My final issue, which isn't really an issue, was the water spilling out of the shower. Not a real issue, but I've stayed at other Renaissance properties where the showers were closed in with glass, sans the tub, also in Chicago. My boyfriend complained of the cold air, every time I came into the bathroom and he was in the shower. LOL. But this again was a very minor issue. I thought the area was great and very convenient to everywhere we needed to go. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job of cleaning our rooms daily. All in all, I will definitely be staying at The Blackstone when I'm in Chicago next. I've been to Chicago 3 times in the past 6 months and I'm sure I will be back soon. Thank you Blackstone for just a most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Modern.”
Reviews.Author: red0725
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for New Year's Eve. We had a lovely corner room on the 15th floor with views of the city and the lake. The room was gorgeous and very clean. Hotel staff was super friendly. Icing on the cake was the unexpected fireworks show at midnight! Higly recommend staying at this historic Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: editorsarah08
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night because we were attending a work holiday party. Under the lowered block rate of $139, it was a steal. The room is very comfortable and warm, with nice fade up-down lights, a great bed, and an oversized chair with foot rest. The extra decor of books on Chicago and art were a classy touch. The bathroom is very large. We were given a handicap room, which was odd, since we aren't, so the room was probably slightly adjusted to that (fold down bench in the shower, almost no counter space on the sink, and the closet's rack was so low, that we couldn't hang a suit bag on it). I'm sure that those inconveniences would be a non-issue with the regular rooms. The adjoining restaurant serves an amazing brunch for just $25 per person. Tons of buffet food, a bloody mary bar, and then they bring out plate after plate of hot breakfast tapas. It's more than enough for a man with a healthy appetite and his wife. We didn't have lunch that day because we were still so full.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic downtown Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: saxorob
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here one night, and then the next night at the new Radisson Blu. Gold recognition here is good - we got a great view of the lake in a really nice end room. Rooms are nicely appointed. The only reason I'm giving it 4 instead of 5 stars is because of the staff in the club lounge - they are quite aggressive about wanting to close up shop in the morning. I came up for breakfast at 8:45 with very little food left on the counter (they stop serving at 9:00). When I asked for a cereal bowl (there was only one left and we needed two) the lady said she would get one, but for me to remember they were closing in 10 minutes. At 8:55 they started carrying away the unreplenished food items. When I asked why they were closing early, they said they had to because there was no food left for them to put out. Moving away the coffee and orange juice dispenser before we could refill? C'mon, guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in an Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SniperMonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July long weekend for two nights. It was a great way to start off our stay in Chicago. Gorgeous decor with a swanky bathroom. The bed was comfortable. There is a Starbucks attached to the hotel. No bed bugs. The staff were very professional. My husband forgot his toothbrush and they gave him a complimentary one. Valet parking is a little expensive but it's the price you pay for the convenience. Most of the tourist attractions are within a 15-min walking distance. These included the Art Institute, Sears Tower, Tastes of Chicago, Aquarium and Metra. We got the CityPass which is highly recommended, especially on the July long weekend. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very nice bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: ranhorn
Reviews.Content: Not sure when they last remodeled this hotel, but they did a very good job. Rooms are quiet and have great features: dimmed lighting, comfy bed, nice shower, etc. Location on Michigan Ave. couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation a success”
Reviews.Author: Pammy1946
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Renaissance Blackstone took on a renovation several years ago. We had the opportunity to beneifit from that renovation. The hotel is lovely with a very European feel to it, especially the showers. Super clean rooms and beautiful surroundings would bring us back to this hotel. The beds were yummy. The only short comings we saw was the bar, very small with little accommodations within the main restaurant. They did however have a smaller venue in the lower level that did work, but that too was very small and was not a full bar.

Reviews.Title: “Reborn Gem”
Reviews.Author: jayclay1
Reviews.Content: Over the past several years this former landmark hotel has seen its fortunes nosedive and then soar. The refurbishing is subtle, well considered and gracious. The colors warm and the finishes very thoughtful. Our stay was comfortable and restful. The bathroom has a glass sliding door, which solves the always awkward problem of the door in a hotel bathroom. The shower has a single fixed glass partition and is large and bright. The rain head is a wonderful alternative to the awful ones we usually find in hotels. Interesting, smart art on the walls and in the corridors fit the ambiance perfectly. A small, but friendly cafe and a high end tapas restaurant supply the food. There is even an art sallery on the meeting room floor.The only drawback to this wonderful hotel is the surrounding area, still finding its way back from years of neglect. But good things are within walking distance and we highly recommend this historic hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patti0
Reviews.Content: Just spend a wonderful Saturday night with friends at the Blackstone Hotel. This may be my new favorite hotel in Chicago! Our double room offered a fabulous view of the lake, the Natural History Museum and Planetarium to the south and Navy Pier to the north. The room was very spacious with white marble desk, night stands and a to die for b/w marble bathroom with european shower that was bigger than some downtown hotel rooms that I have stayed in. The beds are extremely comfy with down comforters and all white bedding. Very nicely done! Downstairs is a wonderful tapas restaurant, Mercat a la Planxa, that offers a great eating experience. Ask to be seated upstairs if you are seeking a quiet dinner since the restaurant is a bit loud. Also, if you are a fan of mojitos, the hotel bar offers the best in Chicago. We are repeat visitors just for the drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 3hapitravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in the Blackstone. We chose the hotel because of the close proximity to the Auditorium Theatre where we were attending a Christmas show. We were very pleasantly surprised by how beautiful the hotel was upon entering the lobby. Our check in was quick and easy, the staff friendly and accommodating. We had a room with 2 queen beds on the 18th floor with a stunning view of Lake Michigan and Grant's Park. The room was large, beautifully decorated and very modern, yet still had the look of a lovely historic hotel. The beds were very comfortable, we all slept wonderfully. The bathroom was spacious and and nicely decorated as well, all very modern and sleek with lots of marble. This room far exceeded our expectations and we will definitely return to this hotel for future overnight excursions in the city. As mentioned in other reviews, parking was pricey at $53 a night, but that is pretty standard in the city. No way to get around that, except to take the train in.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: PAYTON34ILLINOIS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always spend an evening in Chicago to celebrate our anniversary. This year we chose the Blackstone. Very unimpressed. The service was adequate. The front desk clerk never said hello or asked how we were doing upon check-in. It almost seemed as if we caught her right before a break. We asked if our room was a lake view. She said we could upgrade for an extra $40. I suppose the room went un-used for the evening. Would have been nice to get the up- grade, but still had a nice view of the Willis Tower and Harold's Chicken Shack. Was actually quite loud, could here the "L" and emergency vehicles all night. The bed was ok- the pillows were horrible, too big and hard. The room was nothing special. Bathroom ser up kind of strange with slider door and no door on shower. Made for a chilly shower. Probably will choose somewhere different next time, but I suppose for the price and location it served the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Place in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RP1313
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Blackstone. Our room was very romantic with an amazing view. The location and restaurant are very good. My only suggestion is that they should offer more training to the staff. Everyone except the managers seems a little lost. We had a minor situation with our bill during checkout, and there was no manager available until 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: markmoose1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night while in Chicago for a concert. We were able to get a great rate through priceline.com at the Blackstone. Parking is a little pricey at over $50 per night for a valet so we parked across the street in the Grant park south lot for $29. The rooms were very nice and modern. Looks like they were freshly redone. Check in was great and the person was very knowledgeable and had the personality to want to take care of any question you may have. I don't have any complaints but if there was one thing that could have been better were the towels in the room. For a higher end hotel, the towels were not soft and very thin. Other than that I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart accomodation with an edge close to Chicago Bears”
Reviews.Author: ukbeachcomber73
Reviews.Content: Stayed just the night and chose this hotel due to its proximity to Soldier Field, which was around a 15/20 minute walk. Good size room with a huge bathroom and very nicely appointed. We had great views over Lake Michigan and the park. The tube was a short walk from the hotel and can easily walk to Wacker/Michigan in 15 minutes. Friendly staff, good location and chic hotel interior.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nice vibe, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: hrpchc
Reviews.Content: Romantic, funky hotel. Lots to do in the neighborhood, or a 15 minute walk to the river or Greektown. Staff was helpful

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: Wes099
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a modern victorian classic. It's so chic and the perfect distance to all the fabulous goings on in downtown Chicago. Service was excellent. Workers are attentive and incredibly helpful. Loved the atmosphere and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Steffen P
Reviews.Content: Just a fantastic hotel. Beautiful lobby, amazing interior design, everything looks brand new, the rooms are both big, with large marble bathrooms and walk-in showers, as well as contemporary fixtures and furniture. Comfortable bed, reasonably quiet and excellent, attentive service. There was nothing not to love about my one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “A jem in the windy city”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Nov 2011, booked via PL for 105$ a night (2 nights)...a bit pricy but was it worth it. Arrived early (9h30AM) and was provided a room on the 6th floor with a good view of the Lakeside park across the street. Check in was super courteous and friendly. The room itself was just accross the gym entrance, and was huge. The bed was delicious (slept like a baby), the wall mounted LCD TV had close to 90 channels, a nice work station with a good chair and a huge bathroom (with shower only, but i'm a shower person myself) well appointed with good toiletries. A bathrobe was also available, as well as a safe (didnt use either). Very good Wi-Fi available for 12.95$ per day, not a bad price, but do keep in mind it runs noon to noon, so if you buy it at 9PM an evening, it will run till noon the next day, not 24 hours as in most hotels (management was kind enough to credit me one day). The gym was quite big, well appointed with 3 of each ellipticals, bikes and treadmills, loads of Nautilus equipment, and freeweights. Also available are lemon infused and regular iced water, earbuds earphones, small towels, and cold damp hand towels. Nice view of the park mentionned above. Downside is that there is no pool, mind you, this is an older building (1920s methinks) so they did not build pools back then...didnt miss it. The lobby is quite nice, mixing classic 1920s elements with modern ones. The concierge was super helpful, and provided me with maps and what nots. The business provides free internet access and printing (no gouging here) so I checked in and printed my boarding pass online for my return. There are a few restaurants on site, but I used La Bodega downstairs for my breakfast, 6.50$ for a breakfast sandwich and a fruit or pastry...delicious German sausage, with eggs, Mahon cheese, caramelized onion...a good deal (they have 5$ deals weekdays, so even better if your staying then). A few inexpensive places around also: Harold's fried chicken on Wabash, South Loop Club and a pizza place , KFC/Pizza Hut/DD on the same street....plenty of choice for cost conscious travellers. Ran out of shaving cream, and within 5 minutes was provided with some Barbasol (travel size) and a good quality razor! Only downside: there was a marriage going on my last night, sounded fun...but also loud! Given the 6th floor is the lowest guest floor, the music could be heard in my room...called the lobby and was offered a room on a higher floor...but since they told me the party would end at around midnight (and I was watching TV late), I stayed put and the music subsided by 11PM...went to bed then. The hotel is 5-10 minutes walk from Harrison on the red line. Plenty of buses in front of the hotel...the CTA is quite good and efficient...all in all, good location! In conclusion, I loved this place...hope i can get another good deal on PL for this!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Dame”
Reviews.Author: Timoan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days for a 60th birthday celebration. Front desk demeanor and housekeeping can be a little spotty depending on the person. Anna at the front desk was fantastic. Sheets not changed and not vacuumed one day. Upper floors facing the lake are excellent. Back rooms are dark and garish. Doormen are very helpful and kind. Generally, a safe area. Two blocks to the Red line. Close to Field Museum, Aquarium and Planetarium. Go to the Yolk for breakfast, but go early. Otherwise, you'll be waiting for awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jaybird123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October of 2011 and appreciated how smart and helpful the staff was in recommeding restaurants and entertainment. The room was great and I loved having a TV in-cased in the bathroom's mirror in a double sink configuration. Great location and views of Lake Michigan at sun rise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: angiebeans03
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in May of 2011 and it was nothing but perfection! The decor was incredible; unique and modern. The staff were helpful and even recommended clubs for my sister and I to go to, based on our musical tastes. The room was very spacious and decorated in such a way that I never once felt like I was in a hotel. Location-wise it was also perfect in that it was only a few minutes away from the best shopping in downtown Chicago and great restaurants. Overall, this was one of the top 3 hotels I've ever stayed at, and I've stayed at quite a number of hotels. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about the Blackstone and its staff:)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Grant Park.”
Reviews.Author: LifeJourney222
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms here in August 2011. The place is wonderful. Great rooms, staff, and the prices are very reasonable considering what you get for your money. The location was fantastic for us too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, nice location”
Reviews.Author: KingmanP
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a weekend get away to get some work done. The staff were very friendly, and got a nice large room on the 12th floor overlooking the park. If there is one complaint about the hotel itself, it would be that the LCD is not equipped to take external media input like other Marriott hotels have. For runners, the hotel location is great IMO. On the east side you have the park to run in which gives you lots of options on which direction to go, and whether you want to run along the bay or not. On the West side, lots of cheap eats to pick from. On the North side, the classes restaurants are there. Love the location as it is not located near the busy side Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Ecletic property. Very close proximity to Lake Michigan and walking/jogging paths.”
Reviews.Author: girlcats
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Marriott Renaissance property and I can say I really enjoyed the experience. My platinum status upgraded me to a beautiful corner room with a view of the Sears Tower, which proved to be quite lovely. I can honestly say that I was fascinated with the television that was embedded into the mirror in the bathroom. I typically don't bother with tv when I'm traveling - but since I could brush my teeth and watch the morning news in the same room, why not? The room itself was quite nice with a comfortable bed, Eames-style lounge chair/ottoman, refrigerator, and desk. My colleague who had not been upgraded told me her room was nice, but apparently my digs were much nicer. Sometimes status really pays off. The concierge lounge and food were both sub-par at best. I count on Marriott for my oatmeal and what I found at the property was a soupy/sugary/cinnamon concoction that was awful. Evening fare wasn't any better. I'm a vegetarian so typically I can find something in the form of a salad or crudite, but instead they actually server little hotdogs and some sort of bean concoction. I knew I wasn't off in passing less than stellar judgement about the lounge, when I heard a number of other visitors make a few negative remarks about the food. The neighborhood around the hotel is up and coming with a good restaurants within walking distance. Lake Michigan is a short 2 block walk. Once there you can walk in either direction for miles, enjoying the beautiful lake and the Chicago skyline. The gym is a decent size with good weight and aerobic equipment. It was clean and well attended during my visit. If you have good weather skip the gym and head to the lake for a walk/workout on the lake. I'll definitely stay at this location again, but won't count on the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel - just not for kids”
Reviews.Author: not interested n
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely stay at the Renaissance Blackstone again - if I was on my own, or if it was just me and my wife. It was a beautiful hotel with so much history. The location was as close to downtown Chicago as we were going to get with our budget. It was a half hour walk to the downtown core, which was perfect on a sunny day. With Millenium Park right beside the hotel, the walk was beautiful - one of the highlights of our trip. On a rainy day, one would have to take the subway which is surprisingly not kid-friendly. We were a first-timer to Chicago, so we tried to bring our stroller on the subway, which was not only a hazard, but next to impossible. The only reason why I bring this up is because if people were travelling with kids and the weather was anything less than sunny, it might be worth the extra $$ to stay downtown. The room was incredible. Booking on priceline, I had a pretty good idea that we were going to get one of the non-preferred views, which happened - but it was not a bother. The room itself was clean and larger than I was expecting. There was a little white noise with a subway close by, but it was not nearly as much of a bother as some of the reviews I had read. Didn't bother either of us at all. The one and only cash-grab we felt while at the hotel was when they tried to 'upgrade' our room at check-in for $40/night for a better view. The staff were amazing. Everyone was very professional and courteous. The front desk staff, concierges, housekeepers - everyone was great. Back to trying to be a 'family' stay - there was one concierge who had absolutely no idea what kind of restaurant to recommend when I said that I was bringing a one year old child and looking for a family-style restaurant - she continued to tell me about upscale restaurants. I wish I got her name because the other concierges I spoke with were much better. Also - the hotel did not recommend Buddy Guy's Legends at all, which was really surprising. It is basically on the same block, and their afternoon entertainment from 12-2pm was again another one of our highlights. Glad we stopped in to it while attempting to walk to the restaurant the concierge recommended, which was blocks away. We actually stayed there for about 3 hours - it was really a load of fun with the acoustic blues set - perfect for kids. We didn't dine in the restaurant because we figured it would be expensive. We opened the inroom dining menu and the first page was obviously the breakfasts. They cost between $20-$25, which is crazy for breakfast. A few nights later, after a full day of walking and exploring, we were bushed and submitted to going back to the hotel for room service dinner. We got $7.50 hamburgers which were surprisingly one of the best meals we had on the entire trip - FAR less expensive than we figured, and the quality was incredible. I would have happily paid $20 for it. Great hotel - I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My fave Chicago hotel because of the Spanish restaurant, exotic decor, and creative vibe”
Reviews.Author: Adlai
Reviews.Content: I firat encountered this hotel from a general manager of another top Chicago hotel. He took me to its famous tapas restaurant for Saturday lunch. As it is located in the South Loop, it is near the Science Museum as well as the Field Museum, Planetarium, and Aquarium. So it is the perfect spot for lunch after a visit to one of these museums. I recently treated myself to a night there and the hotel is equally opulent and singular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with fabulous view!!”
Reviews.Author: Deanna9
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Blackstone. We were on the 11th floor and the view over Lake Michigan, Navy Pier and the Field Museum was fabulous!! Watching the sunrise was a terrific way to start our day! Check-in was quick and the staff was very friendly. Our room was nice sized, clean and beds were very comfy. Room is very quiet and the bathroom was large and very clean. Location: Easy to walk to Millenium Park, Art Inst, Magnificent Mile, etc. Also close to all transportation. Only complaint is the towels were thin, but I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TraciW126
Reviews.Content: This is a really classy, clean, retro hotel with a very accommodating staff. I got a great deal on Priceline through name your own price and was so thankful! Definitely a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great concierges”
Reviews.Author: Pamela57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a getaway with my sister. The concierges are incredibly helpful, friendly, and enthusiastic, even though you know they have presented the same information countless times. The hotel lobby and floors are tired looking, especially the carpets, which appeared to need a deep cleaning. Given this first impression, I was a bit concerned about the room, but was pleasantly surprised. It was large, spacious, with great decor, very modern. The bedding was lovely, a little nest - I've never slept so well. Check- in staff a little coolish, and no guest umbrellas for us (ours was a priceline booking), would have loved a room with two beds, but that would have cost an additional $30 per night. I would have preferred to be a bit closer, Magnificent Mile, but all in all, the hotel worked. Great tapas restaurant - give it a try. Fitness center one of the best I have encountered.

Reviews.Title: “I thought that it was just old”
Reviews.Author: CarinaJean
Reviews.Content: When I first walked into the lobby, it was dark and old. The carpets were old, the style was old, the reception area unassuming and nondescript. Then I found out that it was a landmark building built over 100 years ago. So, what do you get with a landmark building. The rooms were huge by any metro standard. The room's ceilings were high. The place is built like a fortress and you don't hear anything above you. I love that. The hotel is not in the downtown area, about a mile south from all the action, but only a 1/2 mile south of the Inst. of Fine Arts. There is a nice tapas style restaurant on site. Service is a bit rushed, but food was better than most hotel restaurants. I didn't try the room service. There is a small Starbucks on site. There is a breakfast place 4 blocks further south (Yolks).

Reviews.Title: “Decent with some small limitations”
Reviews.Author: BrokerH
Reviews.Content: As most reviews said, the location is quite good 'cause central to some Chicago must-see. Rooms size is above average. The Mercat is a really good place and very tasty, food a bit posh. Fitness room also better than average in this category. Biggest concern - free wlan in the lobby but they charge 12 USD if you use it in your room?? Do you really need to extracharge for wireless LAN? I had the pleasant experience to be welcomed by a German speaking receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stop-over in Chicago and took the CTA downtown for a Priceline stay at The Blackstone. Was assigned a handicapped room, which was most comfortable for an able-bodied traveler (some of these type of rooms are not so hot for people who aren't handicapped). Had a very good dinner at Mercat, but the service was closer to fair than good. Hotel computers were down the next morning and I was promised an electronic copy of my bill emailed to me once they came back on line. This did not happen, and I had to 'chat' on the Renaissance web site to get an electronic copy of my statement. Aside from the bill issue and the so-so service in Mercat, this is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fun staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fitzit
Reviews.Content: " Welcome to the Blackstone, we have a King Room with a superb view for you" I had to decline the view in favor of a pair of queen beds. I was given the choice of a low floor, still with a view, or a large inside room. I took the larger room. It was perfectly appointed. There wasn't a thing wrong or unexpected, it was what you would expect from a heritage, marque name hotel. If you are on the executive or club floor, the lounge is small, but the Sunday night snack was off the chart. Grilled corn, a selection of cheeses, and a braised roast cut into 4oz chunks. If you went up a second time it was a meal. 14th floor inside rooms are huge, quiet, and clean. there was a huge window looking out to the inner court yard, the offices on the opposed side, look right into your bathroom, and there is no window shade for that one window. Strange thing to overlook.

Reviews.Title: “Great views on the lakefront side”
Reviews.Author: HappyNCTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a free night with Marriott points and thought we would splurge on a night at the Blackstone. The room was nothing special but the view was superb. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a higher floor with a lake view which was breathtaking. The boats, Buckingham fountain and a distant view of the museum campus and Navy Pier. It was hard to leave the room! The bathroom was huge with a great rainfall shower and well appointed although the outlet didn't seem to work. Very clean. Our check in was wonderful and kudos to Drew, who was warm and welcoming and provided superb service! We came in early after check out from another hotel, and she had us in a room before noon, which was perfect. We also had Club privileges on the 23rd (?) floor which added a lot. Evening heavy hors d'oevres and cheese, desserts in the later evening (which we missed) and a hearty breakfast of bacon, eggs, fruit, toast, oatmeal. Didn't care for the eggs, but cereal, toast and fruit was fine for me. It was lovely to have table by the porthole windows overlooking the city. Cozy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bradallen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary last weekend and cannot say enough about this hotel. The room was beautiful and very well appointed. We are modeling our new bathroom shower after the one in our hotel room! The check-in was quick and easy, with our upper floor request nicely honored. Although in the past we have preferred staying further north in the downtown area, we enjoyed the less crowded feel to this location. It is also an area filled with small universities and the younger college student population is a nice change from the North Rush Street crowd. All this added to the fact that you can cross the street to Grant Park and the Art Institute is a great bonus. My wife was very happy with the local shopping. The workout area is very well appointed for both cardio and weight users. We had dinner in the dining room, which was pricey, but convenient since we didn't want to go back out after a long day walking. The food was excellent: must try the butternut squash ravioli. Being just next door to the Conrad Hilton and all it offers is also nice.

Reviews.Title: “old splendor revived”
Reviews.Author: jumper43
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel of US Presidents when in chicago well into the 20th century and the building remains as it was with the major renovation some years ago . I was on the club level so remarks relate to that accomodation which was a relatively large room and bath . Bath reminds of W Hotel .Modern chair i didnt care for which of course is a matter people would differ on . A nice touch is that all lights in the room and bath had dimming capability . Lounge on 23rd floor was 1st class room with books, magazines newspapers and top notch breakfast . Staff at all stations is over the top. Exercise room well equiped offering free headphones . Nearby dining outside of hotel and Hilton across the street is limited with the Firehouse 6 blocks being the best upscale choice. I liked the art deco look .

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par at all”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Barely a 3-star. Dated, noisy rooms (the train runs down the back side with noise from early to late). There was a gap in the cabinets where a mini-fridge should have been and a separate mini-fridge was sitting on the for on the opposite side of the room taking up needed space in the tiny room. No tub, only shower. I paid extra for the club level. After I checked in I asked when evening appetizers would be served and I was told that since I wasn't a Marriott Rewards gold or platinum, I couldn't have access to the lounge. Really? Not conveniently located. Far better choices in this city.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay - comfortable rooms and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lynx46
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference at McCormick Place. I had a relatively small â€“but more than adequate well decorated room with comfortable king size bed, big duvet, many down pillows; good lighting, large bathroom, high speed internet included; plenty of deskspace, easy access to electrical outlets. The only quibbles - yet another hotel whose clock/radio/alarm comes with no instructions for setting the alarm [which is is completely non-intuitive ]. I have a PhD, but it seems Hilton has the only alarm clocks that I know how to set.] Luckily I had my new iPhone. No hotel guide - so, no listing of the available TV channels. And the biggest quibble â€“ a lovely walk in shower with big shower head â€“ but with a fixed glass door that prevented adjusting the temperature of the shower water before standing under it. Who wants to do that? Otherwise â€“ this is a really nice hotel â€“ excellent service from front desk, concierge, doormen, maids. Plenty of elevators. The restaurant [Mercat a la Planxa] of Iron Chef Jose Garces is convenient and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property in Central Downtown”
Reviews.Author: VWC_SD
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Blackstone several times - it's a nice property and conveniently located around the South Loop area. While the lobby is rather small, the rooms are spacious and comfortable. During my last stay, I had an "inside" room (no view, overlooking the A/C and heating units on the roof), but it was incredibly quiet. In the past, when I had an "outer" room, you could hear the sirens at night. So depending on whether you prefer a view or quiet, you can find what you need here. The location on South Michigan makes this hotel convenient to many restaurants and shopping (State street shoppin is easy walking distance, Michigan avenue is longer, but very do-able). If you're staying here, I recommend trying Lou Malnati's for deep dish pizza on South State street (just a couple blocks away). The restaurat in the hotel (Mercat) is also very good. Tapas and good wine selection. In fact, a native Barcelonan said it was good tapas.

Reviews.Title: “..feel like Al Capone...”
Reviews.Author: move2dubai
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Blackstone in March 2011. We had booked the "Public Enemies- Al Capone" Package. The hotel is an Art Deco gem and the rooms are very nice. The staff could have not been more helpful, even though they come with a bit of attitude, which I do not appreciate, as there are people, who can afford to check into the Blackstone and there are people, who work at the Blackstone- both go hand in hand and it's a "manus mana lavat thing". The Tapas bar at the hotel sells great tapas for outside of Spain and their Sangria Blanca is so good, that I had three (3!). Location is also great- right across the street from the "old" world exhibition grounds, with beautiful views. One can walk to Michigan Ave...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: NDFlyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a weekend getaway (and a cubs game) with my girlfriend. The hotel is only a couple of block walk from the Harrison stop on the Red Line, and within walking distance of Buckingham fountain. My car ended parked the whole weekend since it was within either walking distance of Millennium Park, Art Museum and Buckingham fountain, for the rest of the trip we used either the L Train or hired a cab. The room was roomy, with an awesome bathroom (tv inside the mirror) and a great shower. They were out of Lakeview rooms but our City View room gave us an amazing vantage of Sears( I meant â€œWillisâ€�) Tower. The â€œGalleryâ€� Floor is very cool and worth a visit. Overall I was very pleased with the room and will definitely be back! Ps. Did I mention that the skyline of the city at night can add romance to a candlelight dinner?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, reasonable service, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: gstravellerIndia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blackstone Friday thru Monday (2 working days and the weekend). The hotel was amazing for my weekend stay! But working from the hotel room was not the most convenient experience. Let me start with the good. 1. The hotel is beautiful - tastefully done rooms in a beautiful setting. I had a lakeview room and the view was brilliant. I loved waking up to the sunrise over the lake and just drinking in the gorgeous view. 2. I had forgotten my toothbrush and at another time needed a pair of scissors. The hotel did not charge a delivery fee to bring it up (I was surprised - many Renaissance hotels would have charged 12.5 dollars each time) 3. The location was very convenient - the Shedd aquarium, the Field museum, the Millennium Park and Navy Pier are all close by. It also helps that all cab drivers know where the hotel is. 4. Al Capone was at the hotel (yeah .. i know it's stupid but it was kind of cool to stay at the hotel where Al Capone smashed someone's head :) ) 5. When the lounge is open, it is small but tastefully decorated and I really liked the food! What was not so good 1. The wifi is REALLY slow. I had difficulty connecting to my company VPN through the wifi connection and ended up having to use my aircard 2. As a platinum member, I enjoy getting the frills. But I received no room upgrade and Friday through Sunday, there was no turn-down service (with the complimentary bottles of water and little squares of chocolate). Also the lounge was closed all 3 days and I did not get breakfast coupons instead - which many other Renaissance group hotels provide 3. I was working from the hotel all day Monday and did not have time to step out for lunch. But the hotel provided NO lunch options. Since the day was crazy busy with a bunch of calls through the afternoon, I had to wait till I got to the airport later in the day to get a really late lunch. All in all, it's a beautiful hotel with lovely rooms at a very affordable price (when i booked it was cheaper than the downtown courtyard). But it could do with better service for business travelers

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Auntjam
Reviews.Content: Wonderful old hotel, beautifully restored on the south end of Chicago loop, across from Grant Park. We could see the Willisw/Sears Tower from our window. At night it was a beautiful sight! We were just 3 blocks from the Red Line, so we were able to catch it to Wrigley Field easily. The public buses went right in front of our hotel, so we were able to just park our car and use public transportation to get anywhere we wished. The rooms were small, but nice. The restaurant there was delish, but on the pricey side. The tapas add up, but wonderful and worth the price! Only downside of hotel was the price to park our car, $49 a night. Just be prepared for that!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, Beautiful Room, I will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Vacati0n_Junky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blackstone for a weekend trip in late August of 2011 and I have to say, it was lovely. The room was clean, the bed was so soft and I slept very well. The interior of this hotel has been published in magazines and it's just as nice as the photos. The staff was very helpful and polite and made my experience a great one. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very fancy,good location!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinesuz87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for a Cardinals/Cubs series weekend. This hotel was in a great location across from Millenium Park. You would probably have to take a cab or bus to the shopping on Michigan Ave. Since this hotel was a little further south on Michigan Ave, we found that the traffic wasn't nearly as bad compared to the hotels near all the shopping. This hotel had large rooms and it was very quiet. They do not have a pool but do have a fitness center. There is a Starbucks right next door and there is a train station just a few blocks away. I have no complaints about this hotel except that we tried to bring a cooler in and they did not allow us to do so. So we just took our stuff out and put it in our mini fridge in the room:)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sweet T
Reviews.Content: We were very happy w/ our stay at the Blackstone Chicago. From the moment we arrived to the moment we said good bye all of the staff were very friendly and accomodating. The room itself was very comfortable and clean. I loved how the decor through out the hotel was both modern and old hollywood esque. It's really a lovely hotel and we found it to be in a convenient area of Chicago. Our first trip to the windy city we spent most of our days exploring...the Navy Pier, Field Museum, the Bean, all w/in walking distance. You can take the #3 bus all the way to the Magnificent Mile which is very convenient. The hotel's navigator can point you in the right direction if you have any questions on what to do or where to go. We will be happy to stay at this hotel again if and when we are ever back in Chicago - and we hope to be!

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Meiji
Reviews.Content: Location: Very accessible by bus or train. There are a lot of reasonably priced food establishments all within walking distance. For sightseeing, Grant Park, Millennium Park, Art Institute of Chicago and many others are all within walking distance. Their elevators are fast and there's always one available - no long waiting times. Check-in: A very courteous and nice gentleman checked me in. I requested for a room with a view, and right away I was told it was going to cost extra. So I said, forget it. But even if I did not get a room with a view, the guy put me in a very nice room on one of the top floors where I could see a portion of the park, lake and the museums by the lake. Room: Very spacious! And bed was huge! I think it might have been a california king. The pillows were soft and the bed was very comfy. The decor was simple yet elegant. The furniture and carpeting still look like new. The room was clean and there were no bedbugs! :-) Everything around me was quiet except for the low hum of the air conditioner, and the flat-screen TV when I had it turned on. There's not a lot of rooms in each floor (I think maybe around 20) so it felt exclusive. Room features & amenities: A robe was provided (which was inside the closet). Some of my clothes had wrinkles when I unpacked them, good thing an iron and ironing board was provided as well. So sprucing them up was not a problem. There was a mini-fridge and a 1-cup coffee maker which also doubles as a water boiler. There were also coffee pods, teas, sugar, half-n-half - all the things that you would need to make a cup of coffee/tea. I only needed to bring in bottled water and my morning coffee fix was solved. Access to Internet was provided but it was not free. There were wifi and LAN connections. Bathroom: A lot of reviews already mentioned the sliding bathroom door that does not provide adequate privacy. I agree, so make sure your roommate is someone you are very comfortable with. Some reviews say that the shower had no water pressure. Well, it's a rain shower and it's supposed to mimic rain drops, not agitate your skin with piercing water pressure. I found the rain shower very relaxing and soothing. Bathroom features & amenities: Aveeda products - shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion and soap. They were okay, except for the conditioner that had my hair all tangled-up instead of smoothed. I had brought my own conditioner so that was not a problem for me. There were also packets of cotton and q-tips - which I did not expect. Housekeeping service: I always put out the DND sign on my door the night before I slept, and housekeeping left me in peace. I usually left the room around noon, and when I got back in the evening, the room had been serviced. I did not need to call and ask for service. Every day I was there, I got clean towels, fresh supplies, and bed was made up. Price: I had a huge discount but considering I stayed 4 nights, what I had to shell out is still a considerable amount of money. But it was all worth it. Recommend: Yes! And would like to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel. I typically don't like staying so far south in Chicago, but when you go to Chicago in the summer and you have a budget, you take what you can get. The staff was great. I hate to be picky but I did not care too much for the decor and style of the newly renovated rooms. Despite being far from the downtown action there is still plenty of great places to eat. Hotel is across the street from Grant Park which was nice for getting up in the morning and going for a run.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice but we were treated poorly due to booking on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Frogger22
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and have used Pricelines many times in the past with no problems. I had called the hotel at least 2 weeks before our arrival to make sure we would be able to get a room with 2 beds and they said depending on availabilty and she put it down on my reservation. Well knowing that we would be arriving around 2pm I decided not to worry and did not pack a sleeping bag for my son. We were able to get our room with two beds for an $30/night plus additional fees this is unacceptable! I was never told there would be an extra fee just that it was based on availability otherwise I would have packed a sleeping bag for my son. I checked into the DoubleTree in MN 2 nights later again using Priceline and had no problem getting 2 beds and no extra fees. Other than this issue the hotel was nice and clean. Bathroom door as others have mentioned is not a big deal you can other see the other person if they go right up to the door. Also we did have a room with a tub but no TV in the mirror not that I needed either.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: live2travel884
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and modern, the hotel was historic and cool. The location was perfect.- just south of the loop- walking distance to everything. Extra points for letting us check in at 8:00am after a red eye. We were VERY happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: muttger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early August for 4 nights. The hotel was really busy but the service was impeccable and all the employees were very helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious although showing a little bit of wear (our wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom). It was also very quiet - hardly any internal or external noise - which is a HUGE plus for me. The bathrooms are well appointed. The only two requests that they were not able to accommodate were connecting rooms and the NY Times. I highly recommend the restaurant onsite - the breakfast was good too, and the bodega in the basement was very convenient. The fitness space and equipment are are excellent especially for a hotel. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: schlnrse
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was very enjoyable. Very tastefully decorated and terrific hospitality. Location was also a plus. We had a few minor mishaps but they were always taken care of promptly and fully ( eg. clogged toilet at 2 am). My family and I would happily stay here again. Chicago is a great place for a " getaway !"

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: lauranevins
Reviews.Content: I also booked this hotel through priceline. Check in was very simple. The lobby was beautiful and the room was renovated and very nice. The bed and pillows were extrememly comfortable. It was a short walk to the musuems and aquarium, so if that is what you are going to Chicago for, this is a good location for you. If you are going to shop on the Millenium Mile, I would pick a hotel more centrally located on Michigan Ave. This hotel was on the south end and by the time I walked to the north end, I had to take a taxi back. I ordered room service for breakfast. It was not very good and it was outrageously expensive so beware of that. Overall, this is a very nice hotel, I was happy with it. But with the variety of hotels in downtown Chicago, I would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, eager staff, great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: 75xyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. We opted for a city view room as the price difference of a river view was quite substantial. The first room we were assigned was a "14 room", very odd shape. view into the building across the street, old style tub/shower combo, but worst of all right by the elevators. Terrible noise. We requested a different room and in 5 minutes a bellman showed up with keys to an "06 room". The difference was like night and day. Beautiful, spacious, corner room with great, unobstructed city views, walk in shower, nicer furnishings. Mercat is a fabulous restaurant. Great food and service. Kitchen right out in the open, nothing to hide. No turn down service on Saturday & Sunday, yes on Monday.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: fillmap
Reviews.Content: Bottom line- had to sleep on the floor. The room, ammentities and property don't warrant its 5 star status. Better can be found in a better location for much less.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Friendly Hotel Staff - Ever”
Reviews.Author: CJS88
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel - made all the more amazing by the very friendly staff! I've stayed at the Blackstone two times and each time it was a wonderful experience. This property was renovated three years ago, and I must say they did a great job. The rooms I've had have overlooked Grant Park and Lake Michigan (fabulous in its own right) and each had magnificent views. The rooms are spacious, clean, and the beds are comfortable! You have everything you need, and nothing you don't. The bathrooms, too, are spacious and feature white / grey subway marble tiles and huge showers. Note, there was no tub in either of the rooms I've stayed in - so if that is important, you might need to ask for a room with a tub. The location is great. It is south of downtown with easy access to the Art Institute, the Museum of Natural History, the Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, and Soldiers Field. Excellent bus and "El" transportation are nearby. Also, if you like the Blues (and who doesn't) Buddy Guy's Legends is just down the street. The real standout for this hotel, however, is the staff. Absolutely everyone I have come into contact with at the hotel was genuinely friendly, concerned for my comfort, and sincerely wished to assist in any way possible. This is a very good hotel and a wonderful bargain, but the staff make it an excellent hotel. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel for Lollapalooza Weekend”
Reviews.Author: lolla_fan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I attend Lollapalooza every year in Grant Park. This is by far our favorite hotel of the 3 that we have tried downtown. Location is great, staff is more than helpful, and the rooms are spotless. I always expect to hear a lot of noise during festival weekends in the city, but there was none coming from inside the hotel. It was amazingly quiet for sleeping (even the background noise of the El train did not interrupt my sleep at all). On our last night of Lolla, we came back the hotel drenching wet from the rain. I was expecting to get met with dirty looks walking into such a nice hotel, but the staff were just smiling at us and held open the door for us to get inside quickly. Thank you for not judging how I looked that night. The only thing to consider for those sharing a room is that the bathroom door is a frosted glass sliding door that leaves a small opening when shut. If you are a super private person, this may bother you a bit. The other thing to consider is that while a refrigerator is provided in the room, it did not keep our drinks cold (cool yes, cold no). We probably could have called to have a replacement brought up to the room, but it was not a priority for us. I am now waiting for the schedule to go up so that I can book again next year!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: gr1069
Reviews.Content: I was literally next door at another hotel. My wife and I wanted to stay a few days so did one of the discount room companies. The lobby certainly shows it is historic but I am not a fan of historic rooms. This hotel was completely remodeled in 2008. We paid a bit extra for a corner view room where we can see the lake as well as the Navy Pier, etc. The room has plenty of spots to plug in your electronics, comes with Bose stereo, flat screen TV etc. The folks that work here are so friendly and greet you as you come and go. They seem happy to be working here and made our stay all that much more pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Stuart T
Reviews.Content: I came here for my anniversary as we were looking for a nice little getaway and we really enjoyed this. We recieved a nice treat congratulating us on our anniversary and this is a nice touch. Our room had a great view and it was very clean and comfortable. We ate once in the hotel and out for the other times but found the food very good and pricing reasonable as well. We enjoyed ourselves and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel w/ Minor Hiccup”
Reviews.Author: limajt91279
Reviews.Content: Each time I visit Chicago I find myself staying at a different hotel, never fully satisfied with my lodging. This year I got an unbeatable rate at the Renaissance Blackstone Chicago Marriott so I crashed for four nights at this amazing hotel, which is stationed directly across the street from Grant Park. Upon my arrival, I was greeted warmly by the front desk attendant. The gentleman at the front desk was so accommodating. He honored my request for a high floor and even upgraded me to a bigger room (1920). The view was amazing. I could see Willis Tower from one window, and then peek out the other to see the Navy Pier. The room and bathroom were spacious. The marble floors were a bit cold but I got over it. I ate at the hotel restaurant, Mercat a la planxa, several times and I was pleased with its Catalonian offerings. The hotel is on south Michigan Ave, which is a bit far from some attractions but the train (red line) was only about two blocks away. The hotel staff was very cordial but my only complaint about my stay at the Renaissance Blackstone was the 50 minute wait for a Caesar salad to be delivered to my hotel room. I guess the lettuce had to be shipped in from some organic farm in Wisconsin. Despite that minor hiccup, I enjoyed my four night stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mjochim
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay in Chicago. The Blackstone was the perfect choice for us and we got a great deal on Priceline. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were large (for a city hotel) and clean and the common areas were comfortable. Close to public transportation and a short taxi away from Navy Pier and Mag Mile. My only complaint is the towels; cheap quality and not enough of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ctrigg1
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful and comfy, staff is helpful and attentive. A little south for my liking but overall always a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: washmjd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in early July. The location was great, a block or two from the redline. The front desk was very helpful. We had arrived at 9-10AM and they had no issues checking us into a room. They also suggested Yolk, which is a fantastis restaurant for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again. You can walk to Buckingham fountain, Soldier field, aquarium. It was a short taxi ride to Navy Pier and Hanacock tower....

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluecruu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 2011. The hotel was booked solid but never felt overly crowded. The hotel is renovated and feels classy and elegant. The staff is very friendly and are excellent at their job. We could not hear either adjoining rooms but we could hear water pipes, the only disturbance. The location is ideal. Chicago is a busy city and this location puts you near enough to all of the attractions but across from the open space of the park. The only downside I experienced was the hotel does not have a pool, sauna or hot tub. Our window faced south and we could see the rooftop pool of the Hilton next door. Seeing the people swimming and relaxing in the sun made us a little jealous. The Marriott has an excellent gym however.

Reviews.Title: “There were positives and negatives”
Reviews.Author: hirshmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's business meeting with our two children. I did love the history of the place and the location was certainly nice. The staff was friendly and the concierge was very helpful. Having the park across the street was a bonus for our kids and it was a nice walk to the museums. There were some minuses: we had no view, only the view of the other side of the hotel. Water pressure in the tub/shower was disappointing and there was no small refrigerator available in the room (which is nice to have when you have kids). I also was not impressed with the hotel restaurant's breakfast selections. We had a much better breakfast the day before at Yolk's down the street. Room Service also turned out to be a problem. We ordered a small pizza for the kids the night before we left. We were told that it would take 30 minutes- an hour later, we still did not have a pizza. When I called, I was told it was on the way. 15 minutes later and still no pizza (also no apology). We ended up canceling the order. Although the hotel was nice, I'm not sure that we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: One of the BEST hotels I have ever stayed in. Its in a tie position with the St Pancras Renaissance in London. I conducted a very large meeting here with over 120 attendees. This place was incredible, from start to finish. My meeting planner could not say enough positive things about how easy it was to work with this staff. We held our meeting in the historical ballroom, and we invited the hotel "historian" to come in on one of our breaks to present to our audience about some tidbits on the hotel. EVERYONE loved it. Not only is Ryan a great presenter, but just the sheer history of this place, the architectural design, and its location just make is a true pleasure to stay at and the story just rounded out the experience for all attendees. My room was beautiful. I gave it 5 stars, even though it did not get cleaned on one day. However, I ended up having to have my birthday during my stay, and the hotel brought me a bottle of wine and cupcakes. I mean, booze and sweets will make up for any minor discrepancies. I only had a few hiccups in service, which is very rare for Renaissance hotels (I am a Marriott Platinum member, and these are my favorite places to stay). The front desk did not have my Marriott number on file, even though I called in ahead of time to add it to my reservation, and my travel agent had already added it (it was on my confirmation sheet). And, when I asked the concierge about the club lounge and breakfast, she said it was served until 10. When I went up to the club the next morning at 9:30, I found out the food disappeared at 9:00. So,,,,I went back downstairs and asked for local places to go for breakfast. I explained I was gluten intolerant. She suggested breakfast sandwiches at Starbucks (apparently, when I told her I couldn't eat bread, the synapses failed to connect), or eating at the hotel restaurant (which I had already done the night before, and I wanted a change of pace). When I asked for other near by locations, she gave me nothing to work with. Despite my little hiccups, the service, ambiance, and appeal of the hotel made up for it all. The food for our meeting was truly wonderful. AV services were top notch. All the meeting staff were fantastic. Check out my separate review for Mercat. I would recommend a meal here during your stay. You would remiss if you did not sneak a peek at the Ballroom, and the Art Museum on site. And, the fitness facility is one of the nicest I have seen in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: templetx
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Blackstone. Location was great. Hotel staff was courteous. Our room on the 10th floor was comfortable and large for downtown Chicago. I would recommend requesting a room that's NOT by the stairway. We could hear noise reverberating in the stairwell following a Saturday night wedding reception. The hotel's renovations are beautiful and blend modern furnishings with the hotel's rich history very nicely. The internet was ridiculously slow in the hotel business center. We didn't pay for in-room wireless, but I would think it's probably a waste of money if it's as slow as the hard-wired connection.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Littleton_Matt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4 or 5 times in the last year Millions spent refurbishing this historic hotel and it shows! The rooms are moderate in size but very well appointed, bathrooms are impressive, some even have tv's embedded in the mirrors, showers are high end as are toiletries The gym is nicely put together and has what you'll need - i've never had to wait for equipment There is a bar downstairs (small bar) that was very busy when I last visited and a Starbucks too but the real highlight of the hotel for me is the Mercat Restaurant, a true tapas place with around 60 dishes on the menu and very impressive spanish wine list. The staff at the hotel are excellent and know their stuff It's been great for business trips but I wouldn't hesitate to take my wife here for a weekend away. You'll be stunned at how beautiful the architecture is - kudos to Marriott for not making a hash of it, they really brought back the classy feel of the place. Rates seem to vary greatly, i've paid as low as 140 and as high as 280/290 a night here

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. a TV in your bathroom mirror !!!”
Reviews.Author: GlenElgin
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here in July on a road trip when we visited Chicago we got a pretty good deal for a city hotel. The location was really good for us right opposite the park about a 5 min walk to Buckingham Fountain a must place to visit at night there is a light show on every hour on the hour. A tripod and camera moment you also get a good view of the skyline from there. I digress, we were in a club lounge level room which was very modern and well fitted out not the biggest of rooms but very nice. One nice feature was having a TV set in the bathroom mirror great for catching the news when getting washed up in the morning. Or Children's TV to get the kids to clean their teeth a wee bit longer. The staff were very nice and helpful and the lounge again was modern. Although they did run low on food later on in the night. The Valet parking was quite expensive at $47 per night, however the valet when asked informed me of a garage 150yds away that was secure, had in/out privileges and was $25 per night. So I used that which was great. Distance to the millennium park was about 8/10 of a mile and the Hancock tower about 2 miles. If you want to et to the Navy Pier you are only about 2 blocks from the bus route and the 129 bus stops right at the pier.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Chicago. Absolutely love this place'”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkRayman46
Reviews.Content: great place to stay. you get what you pay for. The Blackstone is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: SusanShawnee_KS
Reviews.Content: Majestic grand old hotel on E. Michigan Avenue. First room we stayed in that had a TV inside the bathroom mirror......it wasn't an insert, it was all one flat mirrow. The shower was an actual shower and not a tub. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Hallway was very quiet. Everything.....upscale. Loved the little touches of chocolates on the pillow, turned down sheets, and a bottle of water on the nightstand when we returned from sightseeing all day.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful touches throughout made for an amazing trip!”
Reviews.Author: tigerflight202
Reviews.Content: his place was incredible. Incredible. Admittedly, I completely lucked out with a bid from Priceline, because there would have been no way I could have afforded a 4-night stay here otherwise, but I think I might have to budget myself for at least a night or two the next time I'm in town. The building itself is an architectural gem (but really, what building on Michigan Ave isn't?) and so it the decor inside. I kept thinking it was very thoughfully renovated with a clear eye on the artistic details. The lobby is a mix of old-school charm (cast plaster details, marble fireplace) with new artistic touches ( a rug that recalls a Gene Davis canvas, large steel chandeliers that are a nod to Anish Kapoor's Cloud Gate a few blocks away). The hallways are decorated (the ones I strolled down at least) with black & white city photographs but not postcard images; rather ones that showcase unusual angles of the city and abstract it. The art in the rooms themselves have great pieces- i don't know if they're all different, but I had a fantastic faux-bois with buildings piece over my bed that I wouldn't have minded hanging in my apartment. The Blackstone's website I think mentions all of the work as coming from Chicago-based artists which I think is an unbelievably fantastic idea. I would have liked to have known more about the artists whose prints were in my room (I'm a bit of an art nerd incase you couldn't tell ;) And then....there's the Art Hall. It's own stop on the elevator. The art hall is a beautiful little gem of a room that when I was there, had a great show by local artist- Eric DeBat which I wholely encourage you to view. The pieces are great and very affordable. Now, I'll stop talking about the art & mention the room....Again, very thoughtful details. My room had a stack of books (Creepy Chicago, stuff about Ghosts, Wrigley field.. I don't know if that's the standard assortment or they do some snooping on you ahead of time, but I enjoyed looking through them. The bed was....it was like sleeping on a cloud. I've never slept so well in my life.
