The bathroom was just....huge and the shower as great (although I do love me a good soak in a tub) The door i thought was strange, and I could see if you were merely traveling with an acquaintance it might make things a little more...uh...'intimate' (door is translucent and to be honest, not well sized to the opening, even when closed you could pass a moderately sized paperback book in the gaps to the sides) but I was traveling by myself so who cares. Other amenities include an in-room coffee maker and a small fridge. The Aveda toiletries were luxurious (although I could have used twice the conditioner given) and the service was the best part. The concierge Amanda was so helpful and thoughtful (there's that word again!) with suggestions and websites to check out. It really made my trip a memorable one and I hope to return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomAndKid
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Blackstone right on Millennium Park, a short distance from the striking Buckingham Fountain, its workout room looks right out there. Makes sweatin' on the elliptical totally pleasant (that and the yummy lemony ice water that's always available). The service is impeccable and the showers are honestly like a warm rainshower. Nice to live like royalty once in a while. About the bathroom doors--I have to admit, I was concerned about this. I was rooming with an online friend that I'd just met F2F for the first time that day. What the deal is on this: the bathroom door is a sliding door, but not a pocket door. So once it's closed, from the front, it covers the doorway just fine. From the sides, there's about a 1" gap, if you're looking. I didn't look and it worked out just fine. What we did have trouble with was how hard/impossible it was to get the room changed from one King bed to one with a pair of beds. When we called way ahead of time we were told it would be "noted." When we arrived, though, the answer was a aroundabout way to "No." We made do with a King and a rollaway, which my roommate said was comfortable enough. Frustrating, though. In-room Internet is $12.95/day, but there is free wireless in the lobby, and the lobby has two nice loungey areas. Take time to stop at the Art gallery floor-interesting stuff there. We also rented a meeting room below the main floor and the service and room was great for a get-together. I would definitely stay here again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Slow Wifi, rude awakenings, and no bathtub”
Reviews.Author: soleiltravelor2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is historic, beautiful, and centrally located, but it's lacking in some basic services. Wifi is too slow for citrix or video streaming. I tried calling the front desk twice, and they referred me to the wireless company's hotline in Korea, but to no avail. Also, I didn't expect to have to put on the "do not disturb" sign if Im leaving at 9:30AM, but I should have. Housekeeping woke me up at 8:30, and a phoney "room service" slamming on the door woke me up at 9, and I didn't order anything. I think they just wanted me out. Just a side note, my room had no bathtub, which is important to me. Overall, I've had more pleasant and comfortable stays at the Holiday Inn, for 1/3 the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous”
Reviews.Author: SaddlebillStork
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place. The location and the views from the lakeside rooms are spectacular. Rooms are nice and unusual. I thought the sliding door to the bathroom was neat. It is modern with old world sophistication - best of everything. The lounge on the club floor is so inviting, I could have stayed there all day. But with the museums and Buckingham Fountain just outside the door, who can stay in their awesome room?

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ecojojo81
Reviews.Content: The Blackstone is a really nice hotel on Michigan Avenue. It's a bit of a walk to Water Tower and that area of the city, but close to the Sears Tower, the parks, and the loop. I was there for a wedding and got to see the honeymoon suite - amazing! The regular rooms, which I was in, were really nice. Comfy beds and very quiet. The only thing I would have preferred was a bathroom door that closed tightly, not some modern slidey thing! Oh, and they should really give you free wireless in the room, not just in the lobby. Bummer. But, it's a great hotel - I'd go back. I didn't get to eat Mercat, but would definitely try it the next time - newly Michelined!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it”
Reviews.Author: R0ll0ut
Reviews.Content: I've read the recent reviews and I'm saddened to see there were so many bad experiences as ours was outstanding. I came to Chicago for the 1st time with my lady and we stayed in the most perfect room. The staff was great the location was great for the Taste of Chicago we only had to walk 2 blocks to the Taste. We were 3 blocks from the lake, and less than a mile from the Shed Aquarium and The Field Museum. The staff was very pleasant they even watched our bags when we checked out so that we could finish using our CityPass. The decor in the hotel was nice... loved the Art Hall, The Fitness room and lounge area downstairs... I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Nebraskan030
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the Blackstone. The bright spot was the friendly staff. While the room was large, the bathroom doors were off their track and would not close. We stayed 3 days and each day had to call the front desk to get towels because we didn't get replacements. We did not get clean drinking glasses, our tea was not replaced and the towels were simply threadbare. I get better towels at a Ramada Inn. Very disappointed for the money spent. Would never book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: breakroom
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline, which guarantees two people in a room but not bed types. Since it was my brother and I, I called over a week in advance to request two beds in the room. The person told me such rooms were all booked but she would make a note to have a rollaway in the room. However, when we arrived, no rollaways were available, and we did not receive one until the next night. I understand I used Priceline so the hotel probably is not giving us its best service, but why tell me a week beforehand we could have one if they couldn't provide it? Also, the hotel is trying to be chic, with a sliding semi-transparent door to the bathroom, but it didn't even close all the way and you could see (and hear) into the bathroom from a certain angle. On top of that, the shower door is clear. Not the best for privacy. Finally, rooms are not very soundproof and we could hear all of the action in the hallways, doors slamming, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Preserved Hotel, with Modern Updates to Vintage Style”
Reviews.Author: Jacobs-Family
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property in Chicago for a friendâ€™s weekend, while attending a concert nearby. The property is located in the Columbia/Roosevelt College area with great walking access to the parks across the street, and Navy Pier or Shedd aquarium, depending if you go left or right on Michigan Ave. out the hotel. The L train was easy access thru either the blue or red line, within about 4 blocks of the hotel. We mostly took the red line up several stops to the water, then ventured to the city and walked to explore different areas of town. Used the train to get to/from the hotel and airport as well, took less time and was considerably cheaper than a cab ride. The hotel staff was courteous and friendly upon check-in. We arrived early around 1pm and were able to secure a room right away. Concierge also pointed out great authentic Chicago eats for hotdogs and Italian beefs. There is also a Starbucks located below the lobby at the Michigan Ave. entrance; that was super convenient in the morning. If you are feeling outdoorsy, there is a bike rental shop out on Michigan Ave. to the left 3-4 blocks; easy to rent bikes and tour the coastline up to Navy Pier and the city/beach. *ROOM DESCRIPTION -- King room with City View (basically view of an apartment building; and we kept the blinds closed mostly) Room was large and roomy. Desk and Large flat screen TV, iPod/iPhone player (nice touch), in-room coffee maker (but Starbucks is just downstairs), mini-fridge (empty, which is great and we fill w/ what we want) Bed was comfy with nice selection of firm and soft pillows. Bathroom had walk-in, entry shower with rain type shower head and AVEDA bath products. Closet was able to accommodate both of our travel bags and plenty of drawer space to unpack. We did not use room service or eat at the hotel, but the restaurant was packed for Father's Day brunch and smelt delicious. All-in-all the Blackstone is a well-preserved, spacious hotel, with great amenities and modern updates to the rooms and common decor. It has access to all the downtown Chicago attractions; and we would recommend the hotel to our friends and family who may be visiting the area. Thanks for a great stay Blackstone~

Reviews.Title: “The maids took by Bose Headphones”
Reviews.Author: drmilk1
Reviews.Content: You figure if you pay good money for a great room that the MAIDS would be trustworthy, but they are not. I left my Bose Headphones ($400) in a drawer in my room. I am so upset! I really would NEVER EVER stay here again and if you have any expensive items, please know they will take them as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macikate
Reviews.Content: My husband 'kidnapped' me on New Years Day 2009 for a romantic weekend in Chicago and we stayed at the Blackstone. This hotel is so cool. It totally mixes early 20th century vintage with mid 20th century vintage. I LOVE the carpet in the entry way and up the stairs. I just bought the rug at Ikea that looks just like it. The wall paper in the bathroom was awesome. The memorabilia in the rooms is cool and lets you know the history of the place. I'd love to get a chance to stay here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway spot!”
Reviews.Author: scharping
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blackstone in Chicago during a girls weekend. We had two rooms on the executive level and both rooms exceeded our expectations. The rooms were very comfortable, with plenty of space to relax and socialize. The views from both rooms were beautiful and overlooked the city. All of the staff acted as gracious hosts and they were helpful when called upon. I would highly recommend eating at Mercat, located inside the Blackstone. The wait staff was friendly and the food was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel + customer service”
Reviews.Author: waxonwaxoff
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay whether for work or with family! Customer service is great and pleasant! All the staff smile and will introduce themselves to you to get to know you if time. The Blackstone is an architectual beautey as are the rooms. The tapas restaurant is also very nice if you do not want to venture out. The rooms are quiet, well maintained, clean, and trendy chic. Beds are wonderful. Great place to stay if w family and want to hit Art Museum, Shedd, Soldier Field, or US Cellular for Sox game as it is on the southern end of MI Ave. I have made this location my base when I am working in the NW IN area and will be back here in a week!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel on the park”
Reviews.Author: GoneTrippn
Reviews.Content: I Pricelined this hotel, and I know we all worry that our four-star hotel will not be four stars. This one was. I did read some complaints about odd things that happend to a few visitors. I had no such bad luck. Beautiful, historic hotel right on the park, about five minutes from the Art Institute of Chicago. Granted, it is on the far south end of the park, and most of the action has drifted north. But if you like to walk or take mass transit, this is not much of a problem. It's a straight shot. I did not love Maracat, the restaurant. Seems like it was stuck in the 90s. The reason I'm rating it as Excellent is based partially on value. You've probably stayed at nicer places, but not at this price in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: kms26
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Blackstone on a ladies trip. We had an excellent time at the Blackstone. Super cozy beds and we had a great view of the park. This was a super location for strolling about the city and spending time in Millenium park and down by the lake. The lobby had great decor and the restaurant in the hotel was excellent. One of our favorite meals of the weekend. Excellent tapas and sangria. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Renaissance in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bluejax21
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the Blackstone during a trip to Chicago at the end of May in 2011. The check-in was friendly and flawless, and I was provided a room overlooking Grant Park and the water. It was a great view and worthwhile if you are able to grab a room with such a view. Upon discovering that I didn't bring any shaving cream, I went downstairs to visit the sundries store located next to the front desk. It was shockingly under stocked, and I found myself asking the concierge for a nearby store that might sell some shaving cream. She promptly disappeared and provided me with a small complementary bottle of Barbasol. The rooms sport a great decor with a comfortable bed and large bathroom. I was disappointed to find there were not any waters placed in my room. I rarely find a hotel these days that does not place some complementary bottled waters in them each day. I'm not sure if that was a hotel practice or an oversight. I stopped by the gym, and although I did not work out there, I would say it was impressive. It was by no means small in size, and featured a large amount of equipment. Upon returning from a dinner engagement, I stopped by the 1st Floor restaurant, Mercant a la Planxa, for a nightcap. The place had clearly been busy during the evening, but appeared to be emptying out. I believe it was around 10:30pm. The staff at the bar was friendly, and they told me they closed at 11pm. 11pm, on a Friday? Lots of wasted potential there for a weekend place like that, but that's neither here or there. The menu looked palatable, and I found myself committing to memory that I must try out the tapas on my next visit there. In the morning, I decided on a walking tour of Grant Park to snap some photos instead of a run along the river. The hotel is literally directly next to the park. Aside from a few vagrants, one of which yelled at me angrily when I took a photo of a statue across the street from the hotel, it's a pleasant experience and recommended for any visitor. There is a Starbucks on the 1st Floor, which I consider a plus for the morning coffee fix. A minus is that the Club Floor did not appear open during my visit, and I always make a point to complain when the Club Floor is not open to Platinum Members on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Lifelearners
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night because it was close to the Field Museum. OK, parking is just outrageous but suck it up and pay. It is so much easier than driving around trying to find a lot. So, inside is a fun and funky mix of old time hotel with some modern stuff thrown into the mix. Front desk staff were superb and when our son forgot something when we checked out, a staff member in the lobby went upstairs with us to unlock the room get it. We ordered room service because by 6:30 pm we were hungry but too tired to go get it. We thought it would be outrageous like the parking but for three of us, we paid $63, very reasonable and did I say delish? Yup! My favorite part was the TV in the bathroom mirror. We just don't get out much so this was just too fun. We kept the NASA channel on all night with the space shuttle on the launch pad for a night light, perfect. The only thing that was weird, and others have mentioned this...the bathroom doors that slide are too narrow so you can see someone in the shower from the living room. The room had a high ceiling, closet space, Aveda products (woo hoo) and enough room to set up a small railroad on the floor!

Reviews.Title: “Nice blend of old and new.”
Reviews.Author: Rono
Reviews.Content: We usually stay north of the river and occasionally at the Fairmont but we were attending a Columbia College function and The Blackstone's location was perfect. My first impression was favorable. I liked the feel of an old hotel yet the renovations have brought it into the 21st century. The room was nice sized as I had worried that it would be on the small size like so many of the older hotel rooms are. It was clean, bright, and modern. I'm a shower person so the fact that it didn't have a tube didn't affect me and I didn't hear my wife grumble. I like the walk in type shower and the glass wall made the room seem bigger. I would agree about the bathroom door though, it just doesn't offer privacy. The sliding door seemed at first functional and unique but when closed it left about a 2 inch gap between it and the wall. My wife was sitting at the desk in the room and had full view of me in the shower, not a pretty site. One other criticism was the length of the beds. I'm not a tall person, 5' 10â€� and my feet were barely on the bed when lying down. Might be a problem for someone taller. My overall opinion of the room was good to very good. One thing I like in the morning is a good coffee and you can access a Starbucks without going outside. Something else I was surprised with and is worth mentioning was parking. It was the typical $40 something charge for valet but we wanted to do some shopping after checkout so I asked what I could do with my car. We had checked in at 10:00 a.m. on a Sunday and checking out by 11 on Monday. I was surprised that I could leave my car there till 5:00 p.m. without additional charge. Staff was very helpful and accommodating, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big room, great view, weird bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blackstone over Memorial Day weekend. We flew in at around 1 PM and took the Blue Line train from O'Hare to Jackson Street and then the Red Line to Harrison. It would've been better just to walk from Jackson since we waited for about 10 minutes and it was only one stop which we could've walked more quickly. It was raining and was only a few blocks from the train stop to the hotel. We got to the hotel a little after 2 and were able to check in. We had booked the room through Priceline a couple months ago and had called and requested 2 beds but they said there weren't any available. We asked for one when we got there since there were 3 of us sharing the room and they offered us a lake view room with 2 queen beds for an additional $30/night so we jumped on it. The room ended up having a fantastic view that we were able to enjoy off and on over the weekend since it rained a lot. When we left on Memorial Day the view was stunning since the weather was perfect. The room they gave us was huge, so big in fact that the 37 inch LCD HDTV looked rather small while sitting in the bed. Maybe it was a bit smaller but the picture was great nonetheless. The beds were extremely comfortable. The only real issue we had with the room was the bathroom. This bathroom needs its own paragraph since for whatever reason it had a sliding door that didn't even cover the full doorway! A horrible design and completely ineffective. Basically the door provided zero privacy so if you have this room to yourself it's not a problem, but I just hope that you're REALLY comfortable with whoever you're with if you're staying there with anyone. Not only did it give a straight sight line into the shower from the main room with the door slid shut, it also did nothing to muffle any noise. A fan or something would be nice. I was woken up on Sunday morning by the shower which sounded like a dang waterfall right next to my bed. A little common sense in room design goes a long way, people. Something I guess I've taken for granted all these years at other hotels. The actual shower in the bathroom was nice as it was a rainfall design, but the wallpaper is a bit of a question mark. OK well enough about that since I really did like the hotel. We had a 9th floor room that looked right out to Buckingham Fountain and we could see towards downtown and the Navy Pier to the north and down to Soldier Field and a few nice looking museums to the south. A great view of Grant Park. A big plus to get a room with one of these views. We had a perfect in-room vantage point for Saturday night fireworks that were going off around 10 PM in the Navy Pier vicinity. The location of the hotel is a bit south of most of the Chicago hotels we were looking at and we did end up walking a lot over the 3 day weekend. We took the Red Line to a baseball game at Wrigley Field and it only took about 45 minutes or so to get there. We definitely recommend going to a baseball game if you're in Chicago. We had a great time and met a bunch of great people while sitting through a 3 hour rain delay waiting for the game to start. The housekeeping was great and the people at the hotel were all very nice. We had a few meals nearby, one at Yolk which was about 4 blocks south on Michigan Ave which we would highly recommend for breakfast. We also ate at a nearby Lou Malnati's on State Street that had some really good deep dish pizza. Overall we had a nice stay at the hotel and look forward to a return visit to Chicago at some point in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Meh!”
Reviews.Author: MaureenJohnsburg_IL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Blackstone for a wedding. I booked the room 6 weeks in advance with the "wedding planner" & was given the "wedding party rate". I asked for a double bed room being there were 3 "sisters" staying in room together. I was told there were no double bed rooms available, only king & I'd have to wait upon check-in IF a double was avail. Weeks before our stay, I called & asked for a double room, replied to their automated email reminder of booking (anything they can do for us? Extra towels, pillows, etc??) with the same double room request - else roll-a-way if stuck w/king bed - always told - no double rooms available... gotta wait until check in. I get to hotel, PRE-register @ 11:30am... asked for double bed room....nope - none - zip. I asked if I'm stuck w/King - I'll need a roll-a-way. The check-in clerk responded as if he was looking right through me, saying there's a "convention in town, I'll make sure you'll get a roll-a-way." Later @4pm, checked in... asked for double bed room, mentioned the "wedding party"...nope, same response, blankly stated "all double rooms taken....there's a convention in town, etc.... no mention of roll-a-way - so I had to ask AGAIN for the roll-a-way for the King room. Meanwhile, my brother was checking in - who booked his room the night before.... HE GOT A DOUBLE BED ROOM. Peeved, I took my issue to the father of the bride (who was shelling out huge $$ for the wedding at the Blackstone) - who immediately went to the "stone-faced - scripted "convention in town" excuse of a clerk.... Father of Bride discussed issue w/check-in clerk, dropped the "event planners name" - and WA-LA - suddenly, they had a double room available. Upon arrival of room.... Father of Bride & me examined room for "completeness, (it truely had TWO double beds) cleaniness, etc..." & deemed it acceptiable. Upon use of the room..... we found only ONE skinny bar of soap to be used for sink and shower..... no top sheet on either bed... only down comforter and fitted sheet. I was suspious if they even changed the sheets. VIEW was crap of a view of other hotel room windows, skimpy towels, and they charged $5 per 1 liter bottle water that was placed next to the 1 cup per use coffee maker. How tacky (and tricky). Sure, they had marble bath room counters & floor, marble tops on night stand, a valet dresser, crappy shower head (no water pressure) - big deal. The bed firmness was no better than a moderate priced hotel. No place to put your suitcase (other than the OPEN shelved dresser - which only can hold a overnight size case). The final offense, the (meh) check-in clerk... only activited ONE room card. We discovered the other card was not activated when trying to get into the room..... having to wake the sister who used the "activated card" and was already in bed, sound asleep. We pounded on the door to no avail.... finally a maintenance man walked by, asking if we needed help..... he tried the key.... nope.... he walkie - talkies someone - who didn't know what to do.... finally I suggested he use the floor "house phone" to contact front desk.... who then called the room - to wake my sister.... who then opened the door. No one offered to send up a "activated key card". They had no problem calling the room - waking a "guest". As a "professional hospitality business" - you would think the notion of reactivating a key card & immediately running it up to us - without disturbing a guest would be something they would suggest first.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, dirty lobby, charges for internet, not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: catcow
Reviews.Content: My first impression upon entering the lobby was someone should shampoo this dirty carpet. The room was clean and nice once I was able to get the malfunctioning lock to open. (it took 3 to 6 passes of the key card to open the door every time I entered the room.) There was only a shower in the bathroom. This would have been fine if there was decent water pressure in the shower. The highlight of my stay was when I ask for towels at the front desk upon returning for dinner. I had one towel and two people in my room. The towels were brought to the room promptly. At 11 pm that night the front desk called the room and woke me up to ask me if the towels has arrived! Top this off with having to pay an extra fee for internet access that lasts less than 24 hours. Will not stay here again and do n t recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMilkMan2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and I had a great view of the lake. My only issue with the hotel is it's slightly south of the loop.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite”
Reviews.Author: javl
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The old Blackstone was a grande dame--and now they've renovated it beautifully and impeccably. Still elegant, with very chic rooms. Spacious, fantastic bathrooms, beautiful linens. Everything top line and elegant. The staff are all wonderful, helpful and clearly proud of their hotel. I am a woman traveling alone and felt very safe. When in Chicago, I usually stay at the Hilton on Michigan Ave, which is very nice but HUGE. Part of why the Blackstone is wonderful is that it gives the same (actually, better) quality but on a much more intimate, manageable, and personal level. The restaurant--a Spanish tapas place--is also wonderful, both the service and the food. I stopped in late one night for a tapas and glass of wine. It was perfect and delicious, and the staff was very welcoming and helpful. Likewise, the breakfasts were delicious, interesting, and healthy--and not as outrageously expensive as it would have been at a big hotel like the Hilton. It was also relatively inexpensive (by $50-100) than other comparable downtown hotels. This is my new favorite hotel anywhere, and I will definitely stay here next time I travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Problems at check in, but won me over with mints”
Reviews.Author: JENNMCC
Reviews.Content: Girls trip to Chicago booked through Expedia by friend's husband for a suprise 40th birthday trip. The lobby is very classy and has character so we were impressed when we wallked in. Went to check in everything seemed ok, asked for a room with a water view and we were on our way. After getting to our room the front desk called and said the credit card had not gone through and we had to come back down. We thought a good time to ask about the water view considering the only place we could see the water was standing at the far window and craning your neck. When we went back down, my friend was not treated very well since they kept acting like her credit card was no good. After 45 minutes they realized it was their computer system, not her card. They then asked for $200 cash deposit, they were doing her favor because it should have been $300 for the 3 nights of stay. Luckily she had that much cash. I thought this entire situation was handled very poorly. First they made her out to look like a person with out credit then they demanded cash. Instead of saying you are already checked in we will deal with the issues when our computers come back up. Less than an hour passed and they called to say the system was up and the card went through and she could come down to get her cash. The clerk realized that it would be nice if he brought the cash up, so he did. Thank you! The room was nice and comfortable. The bathroom was very large and clean, the only problem was the sliding door that most people have commented about. The bed only had a duvet, so this was problem with temperature control. Too hot with cover on but nothing lighter to cover up with so then you would be cold. A sheet would have been nice. I realized most people don't stay in their room at night and play games but we did and we only had a very little table to put between the beds to play on. The hotel was quiet, the halls and the outside noise. We took advantage of the fridge and microwave. The location was fine. We actually enjoyed the walk. The red line L stop is also close to the hotel. Very easy to get to Wrigley. On our second night we got back to the lobby and I asked if they had any chocolate mints in the gift shop because I had a craving for mint. They said no but then another clerk asked what room we were in. Five minutes later he was at the door with a handful of mints from the club lounge. That is service! Iron Chef Jose Garces has a very nice Barcelona tapas style restaurant in the lobby, Mercat a la Planxa. We stopped in our last night and went to the bar. Kenny the bartender was the best! We enjoyed some tapas, sangria and a few custom drinks by Kenny. A very nice way to end our stay. On a side note Echo Limosuines provided us with great service to and from ORD.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: MamaDep
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms appear to be recently renovated...bathrooms with carrera marble, nice silky to the touch bedding, comfy bed (but not so comfy pillows), and Aveda toiletry. I had an interior room with view of the school/classrooms and other hotel rooms so not much privacy...but the bright side -- less traffic noise over the rooms that would face the street. The room size was small, but decent by downtown standards. It would be fine for a party of 2, but wouldn't book it for leisure travel with the kids. I opted out of the room service to gain 500 extra points. I did not eat at the restaurant hotel, which is run by the new Iron Chef Jose Garces(spelling?). But heard that hotel did not allow room service food to be consumed any where else other than in the room! The location of the hotel is in the south loop. As a solo-female traveler, I do not feel as safe in the south loop as I do in the north loop. But like with all places, just a bit of common sense and cautiousness will do. I took my chance and walked around the area...found lots of different eateries and the subway/"El" was 3-4 blocks away. In fact, I took the Blue train back to O'Hare and it was pretty easy. Kudos to the bellman and staff. They were always friendly and helpful. Though I would recommend it, this would not be my first choice due to preference to stay in the north loop and there are other hotels of better value.

Reviews.Title: “Cash is not good here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a confirmed reservation for this hotel for one night. As we don't use credit cards, I called the hotel to verify our reservation and asked about paying with cash. No problem, I was told. Just need a credit or debit card to make the reservation. We arrived at the hotel and the desk clerk asked for our credit card. I explained that we would be paying with cash. No deal. He said they don't take cash, and haven't for several years. Will I EVER stay here again? No.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location for museums”
Reviews.Author: dutchgirl73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Blackstone April 2-5. We were planning on spending a lot of the trip in the Museum Campus area and this seemed like a good location. Besides being very convenient it was also a nice view of the lake and Grant Park from our room! The front desk was very friendly and accommodating at check in, and our room was ready early as I had requested when I made the reservation. When we stopped by and asked for a corkscrew on our way up to our room one night, one was promptly handed over. (can't believe we forgot the corkscrew!) The room was fine, a little disappointed in the lack of an in-room fridge but no big deal. The bathroom is very cool, but a little odd with the sliding door that doesn't actually close as other reviewers have mentioned. Easy enough from here to catch the subway up town for shopping, I would definitely recommend this hotel to people interested in staying in the south loop area.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: kaibab78
Reviews.Content: I booked the room over the phone with Marriot reservations. When I asked what the cost was for parking the agent said ~ I am checking my screen. There is no charge for parking. ~ The parking fees were $47 per night! Not a good way to start a weekend. The mattress was not comfortable - it sank in the middle. On a good note - the location is great, good quality linens, large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: brad120
Reviews.Content: The Blackstone is beautiful. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The staff is very friendly. I recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel good but not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: glented
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with impressive rooms. The house keeping was impressive although I was caught out by room service knocking on the door at 8.30 am on first day of stay (remembered to put DND sign on after that). The only dissapointments (and I appreciate that these are not everyones requirements) were the lack of a stand alone hotel bar and no room minii bar. Also the breakfast was very expensive and the choice more limited than othe Chicago hotels I have stayed at. ( I would recommend that you walk 5 mins up Michigan Avenue for breakfast a 'Yolk'. I was also surprised to find no hotel guide in the room. This may explain the confusion over internet charges (as I was leaving I could hear a guest calling to complain on this) In conclusion a beautiful hotel which is good but could be brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, & close to everything we did!"”
Reviews.Author: chachisig
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. Our room was cozy and modern. It is on Michigan Avenue and we were able to walk to the Field Musuem and other places. I called ahead and requested an early check in time and we were able to get into our room about 9am. The front desk was courteous and the rooms were cleaned daily and always by the time we got back to our room in the afternoon. Recommendations *Field Museum was awesome. *Learn to take the train. Everywhere we traveled that was not on foot we took the train. It was very easy. They even have a website you can map your trip out on. Very easy and safe. *Everest. We ate here one night. Fine dining. It sits on the 40th floor of the Chicago Stock Exchange. It is pricey, but it was a wonderful experience. The food was awesome. Again, it will cost you some $$$ though. *Billy Goat's Tavern. "CHEESEBORGER CHEESEBORGER." A Chicago tradition. I think there are two locations now though. We went to the one on S. Michigan Ave. Twice! You have to walk down a level from the main street. A hole in the wall with great burgers. A must do! *Second City. The comedy show was great and we ate at the Mexican food place right next door...also awesome! We stopped at the Old Pub for drinks after the show. A cool old place. We found a coupon for Second City on Bloomspot and saved us some $$. *Bar hop! My wife and I strolled a block east of Michigan Avenue and just walked around and hit some awesome hole in the wall pubs. Sample as many local beers as you can get your hands on since Chi-town has a lot of breweries.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: WorkTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to spend the weekend in Chicago for a quick getaway. I found the Blackstone online and there were some good specials. It is located by the subway as well as bus stops so anywhere in the city was easy to get to. The rooms are just beautiful. The lobby is impressive, and everyone was so helpful. Our view was pretty bad, but we had one of the cheaper rooms, I was told there are some great views of the lake if you pay for those. The restaurant was very busy, but very good. Good food and cocktails. All in all it was a wonderful weekend getaway, and we plan to go back often!

Reviews.Title: “Recently Remodeled with a great location”
Reviews.Author: pacolsu
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel as it had a great location on Michigan Avenue as well as a " stay 3 nights get 1 free" promotion. The property was very clean with a staff that was very friendly and outgoing. The concierge was dead on with 3 dining recommendations. One was a local shop specializing in the Chicago "Deep Dish" pizza and he indicated it was favored by locals. The room was on the 17th floor and we had a great view of the lake. The room was clean but was warm and stuffy despite having the thermostat set to 65 degrees. We finally turned off the heat and that seemed to help. Only thing it was missing was a mini bar-but that was a minor inconvenience. we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaLHansen
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Blackstone is a wonderful experience. We enjoyed our room and the service from the front door bellman to our checkout. Beautiful decor, great sleep, so clean and beautiful. A pleasure to stay there and would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near Museums”
Reviews.Author: JAL6982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Blackstone for 2 nights in February and we were pleased with the hotel. It was old with a modern flare. Great view of Lake Michigan. Only a $6 cab ride to the Field Museum and Shedd Aquarium. Check out Lou Malnati's pizza nearby. Parking is $49 a night and there are lots nearby for $30. We would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “BATHROOMS..........”
Reviews.Author: GoslcREAL
Reviews.Content: My wife and i traveled to Chicago for a leisure trip and stumbled upon the Blackstone. This hotel had everything we where looking for from a starbucks in the lobby to bathroom wallpaper that will knock your socks off. Staff was great and location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect space for wedding or an event”
Reviews.Author: 773gal
Reviews.Content: I've hosted a marketing summit at The Blackstone the past two years. I have been completely happy with every aspect of the event from working with Ashley, the amazing event director who was great at helping to create the perfect event to Swank AV who went above the call of duty to make sure the sound and AV went off without a hitch to the support staff that almost magically appeared whenever I needed them. The crystal ballroom is BEAUTIFUL and the perfect backdrop for a wedding. I would highly recommend this venue for any event

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown choice”
Reviews.Author: traveler from Hinsdale
Reviews.Content: I had three rooms for two nights for my extended family for our annual holiday weekend in downtown Chicago. The Blackstone was easy walking distance to the Art Institute, the theatre district and Macy's. The rooms overlooking the park were gorgeous and we had a view down to fireworks at Navy Pier. The bathrooms are very similar to The Trump, a much more expensive hotel. My advice, skip the breakfast at the hotel-it's not very good--and head out to one of the local spots.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and beautifully restored”
Reviews.Author: occtravellerphx
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Blackstone. The room was extremely comfortable, The bathroom was out of this world with its elegance. I attended at training and part of it was held in the Ballroom. The Ballroom is so elaborate and just a visual feast for the eyes

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: satchel21
Reviews.Content: The Blackstone is a great hotel. Check in was a breeze. The concierge was helpful and was able to get us dinner reservations at a really good seafood restaurant. They truly believe in customer service at this hotel. The room was large. They have marble floors and a marble desk. We stayed in a king room on the 6th floor. The bed was comfortable and had a down comforter. There was no top sheet which we found to be odd. I really liked the toiletries in the bathroom The mint rosemary soap and shampoo made for a really nice shower. Just so you know, there is only a shower and no tub in the room. There is no shower curtain just a glass partition. There was plenty of hot water and good water pressure. My only complaint about this hotel was noise. There was a wedding reception a few floors down and we could hear music. I really think that if we had been put on the 8th or 9th floor we would not have heard a thing. We were so tired by then end of the night that it was not too much of an issue. My advice is to request a room on a higher floor if one is available. Overall this is a great place to stay. We would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Telekelly
Reviews.Content: Went for weekend getaway to Chicago and stayed at the Blackstone. It was the perfect hotel. Small but big, with great comfortable beds. The location was great for walking to everything we wanted to see. Our room looked out over Lake Michigan which was amazing. The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant in the hotel was also a pleasure. If I return to Chicago this is were I would like to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizVandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blackstone for 4 nights for a conference this November. The first thing that struck me was the gorgeous lobby and the helpful front desk staff. Room was spacious and clean. Bed was very comfortable, however the train runs one block behind hte hotel and it was a bit loud for me as I am a light sleeper. I was originally in a room toward the back of the hotel where the noise from the train wasn't bearable and they moved me immediately when I complained. Great restaurant, Mercat a la Planxa is connected to the hotel (run by Iron Chef Jose Garces) although it is a bit expensive. Hotel also has a good fitness center and is very close to Lake Michigan. The Gage restaurant about 5 blocks north on South Michigan Ave was a great restaurant; definitely check it out if you are staying there.

Reviews.Title: “I <3 Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: G10b3tr0tt3r
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I adore Chicago- It is a fabulous city. And this trip marked my second time being there. My first time there was incredible, so this second trip needed to measure up...and it did! About the Blackstone: Check-in: I had requested two queen beds, unfortunately they didn't have that available so my friend and I were given a king room instead. It ended up being great! Our room had a stunning view of Grant park, Lake Michigan, some of the downtown buildings and Navy Pier (bonus: we got to see the fireworks that were on Saturday night). Obviously, my friend and I had to share the bed, but it was large enough that it felt as if we had our on beds. Room: PROS- Super clean, large bathroom, comfortable beds, mini fridge (not a bar fridge with things to buy in it, an empty fridge!) CONS- The bathroom door-- it slides, but when someone walks by they can see it. Not private enough. The drawer space was minimal. Parking: EXPENSIVE!!! If you are driving in, there are other parking lots near the hotel (on Balbo) that are about $12 a day...a far cry from $47. Look into it. Staff: The valets and doormen are quite friendly and there is always some there to fetch you a cab. The concierges were o-k. Not as friendly or upbeat, or even as knowledgeable as other ones I have spoken to in Chicago. It was kind of a let down for me. Cleaning staff was very friendly. Location: It depends on what is happening in the city because the location can be amazing or just "meh." I prefer to be closer to Magnificent Mile/North Loop ( which is more central to a lot of things, whereas the Blackstone is South Loop area. But keep in mind that this hotel is super close to Buckingham fountain and a short walk to Millennium Park. Some other things to keep in mind... -We found that there was a lot of commotion on the street- honking and sirens etc. For some that might be annoying, you may want to ask for a room that doesn't face the street...but it didn't bother me- after all Chicago is a busy city, so that kind of noise is expected. -There is a Starbucks connected to the hotel which is quite convenient. - They have computers by the front desk that offer free internet (printers available too).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaH301
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The bed provided the best sleep EVER! The noise level was amazing -- heard no one and was able to sleep soundly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 1 night stay made me wish I was in town longer”
Reviews.Author: sellinrain
Reviews.Content: First off let me preface my review by sharing 2 important details: I'm a Marriott Rewards Gold Member (about to be platinum) and I booked my room on a prepaid rate plan direct with Marriott. So while there were large blocks of hotel rooms reserved for a huge trade show that was in town the 3rd week of September, it seems like they treated me differently. I paid less than $200 for 1 night's stay and they upgraded me to a suite on the top floor with corner views of Lake Michigan and the Chicago skyline. I was truly floored. I would have to think a room like that normallly goes for $750 a night or maybe more. They had little TVs imbedded into the mirror in the bathroom and a skylight with a remote control retractable shade (for sleeping, which I didn't figure out until the next morning, oh well). So it was probably just my lucky day and I'm sure there is no guarantee anybody would ever get that room at that price again, but it sure made my extremely brief business trip much more pleasant and enjoyable. I would definitely return again. Surely even the smaller rooms must not be too far off.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Is this where I stayed last year?”
Reviews.Author: carole6860
Reviews.Content: I spend a fair amount of time at Marriott properties so I was looking forward to returning to the Blackstone. My last stay here was a very comfortable room overlooking the lake. I swear it was in this hotel but you would never know it from my current experience. If anyone assigns you to room 1709, pick up you bags and head across the street to the Hilton. The room is small and cramped. The housekeeping entourage arrives early in the morning and will actually surpass the sound of the elevated running outside your window. Did I mention the ice machine? So if you are Marriott gold you might think you will have access to the concierge floor to get away from all this noise and clastrophobic conditions..........think again because I am, and I didn't. Instead, I had the to entertain myself by imagining that the water tower or whatever structure that was next to the vacant lot outside my window was actually retro "Petticoat Junction" Oh yeah, and cell service.......forget it. This tip....need to make a business call on your cell? Try the alcove outside of Starbucks because every other location in this hotel either has music blaring or doesn't have reception. As for staying here? Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeIn
Reviews.Content: We attended a n out of town wedding at the Blackstone. The wedding was at the Fourth Presbyterian Church on Michigan Ave. The reception was at the Blackstone and the room and food were wonderful. The room where the reception was held reminded me of Versailles with mirrored doors that opened at night to Grant Park. We stayed at the Blackstone and liked our room much more than the Hilton, across the street, where we stayed two weeks before for a convention. At the Blackstone you are across from Grant Park and you can walk to the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and the Planetarium. Friday night before the wedding, we went to the roof of the Wit hotel for drinks and had dinner at the Cibo Matto. The roof was fun but the food at Cibo Matto was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a queen!”
Reviews.Author: aks001
Reviews.Content: We loved the Blackstone! Complimentary wine, cheese and crackers for our birthdays. All the staff were great. Very comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Above Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: traveler2010_4
Reviews.Content: Service, Hotel Amenities/Rooms, Location were all exceptional. We stayed on the 14th floor and it was quite and had a great view of the lake. The elevators were quick an always available. The service desk was polite and let us check in early (10 am!). The bed was very comfortable and room service came in once in the morning and at night to make it for us - leaving chocolates on the pillows. The bathroom was very clean and quite large. Nothing bad to say and we've had some bad hotel experiences. The Mercat restaurant attached was great for dinner. Highly recommended for convenience to Grant park and lake shore area. Also recommend parking down the street in public parking - it was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Snazzy, but snug.”
Reviews.Author: yymmat
Reviews.Content: The Blackstone is a lovely hotel readily accessible to those driving into town. Parking is steep at $35/day, but not out of range of other similar locations. The hotel is not easily accessible for anyone with movement disabilities - wheelchair, crutches, etc. The rotating doors aren't overly large and the side doors are also on the smallish side. Even to get to those, you have to go up a few steps. More steps greet you once you're inside. We stayed on the Club Floor in a very posh room with a king-sized bed. The room was slightly smaller than what you'd expect in a standard hotel. It was furnished attractively with trendy, modern furniture. While the room was lovely, it wasn't made for lounging or spending any extended period of time. There was a desk chair and one comfortable chair, but no other place to sit other than the bed. For my husband and I, the most surprising feature was in the bathroom. There was a television as part of the mirror. The remainder of the bathroom was nice and pleasant for a hotel. The shower fixture was a rain-style showerhead and provided a nice shower. The tub was standard-sized. The room was clean. Staff were pleasant and helpful. We had a pleasant stay, but we would have liked slightly more space to move around and be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Its an attraction of its own right!”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blackstone for three nights in early July and were very happy with our stay. The renovation really do magic to the property. You can appreciate the grandiose classic aspects of the building while enjoy the trendy touches. The room was simply yet very well decorated and well maintained (well it is really new looking). Both the room and the bathroom were modern and spacious. Given its historical significance, The Blackstone can almost qualify as a tourist attraction itself. Each rooms are decorated with historical mementos. The art hall does contain some interesting works. The checkinâ€”checkout process was slower than we would like, but the services/staff attitude were otherwise excellent. Location-wise, it is reasonably close to the L, and it is right across the street from Grant Park, so close to all the downtown tourist attractions. The dining and shopping options in the area is certainly not comparably to the magnificent miles, but that is only a few subways stops away. Overall, it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disabled Friendly; SHOULD BE NUMBER 1 HOTEL IN CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: WA frequent traveller
Reviews.Content: Before I begin---there are two Renaissance hotels in Chicago. Make sure the airport shuttle knows that you want the one on Michigan Ave. Actually the front door is on Balboa, but the address is Michigan Ave. I spent a week at the Blackstone on a govt rate which is a real deal. It is under $200 and includes free internet in your room and coffee and a pastry at Starbucks each day. One person mentioned the stairs at the front door into the lobby as an obstacle. Two doors away towards Michigan Ave is an entrance that leads to an elevator to the lobby. The same elevator takes you from the lobby to the dining room and down to Starbucks. It is seperate from the elevators to the rooms. So I never had to walk up or down any stairs during my stay. I can only duplicate all the raves about the attractiveness and quality of the rennovations. This is truely first class and beautiful. I agree with the commments about the cheezy Al Capone art gallery and the wierd gift shop. The concierge was great but not always there. She efficiently ordered tickets to Billy Elliot for me and provided excellent directions. Taxis to the Loop and the theater district ran between $6-$8 each way. I was working in the Loop so was there all day and ate lunches there. In the evening I found that the hotel did not have many good restaurants nearby. The one complaint I had was a restaurant recommendation by one of the desk staff that was a cab ride away and really not worth the effort. It was nothing special. (Unfortunately I had left my Zagat books at home and did not know the area.) I did eat lunch in the hotel dining room while waiting for my room to be ready. I had the lunch special----the fig salad was a winner; the steak item I ordered was a real loser. Not what I would expect from an Iron Chef---ALL SHOULD BE GOOD and consistent. The dining room is pleasant, but was noisy which is one of my pet peeves. Waiter was a bit brusk. Have to mention the bathroom as does everyone else here on trip advisor. The walk in shower is great, although I prefer a massage shower head to a rain shower head. The wall paper is interesting--I liked it ---but did not notice the hook near the shower door to hang my robe until I had been there two days. The marble desk and sink counters are beautiful and large. Desk was a great work area. Rooms are large. Bathroom is huge by hotel standards. Beds are comforatble. Staff do not wear name tags but readily introduce themselves by name. So after a week I had a bunch of names. Staff training is obviously taken seriously and customer service is the norm here. Everyone asked if I was enjoying my stay or needed anything. I am a quality management consultant and they are a text book case. All in all it was a great week. I travel a lot and stay everywhere from Motel 8 to five star resorts. I would put this one right up at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes it great”
Reviews.Author: OnthemoveChicago
Reviews.Content: As far as I am concerned it is the staff that makes this hotel so special. Although the accommodations were very nice (it is a historic hotel that went through a major renovation project (a mix of contemporary art and historic grandeur) and beds are very comfortable and the shower is amazing), my experience with the staff at every level was excellent. They were all exceedingly conjugal and helpful. The Blackstone Hotel is comfortable and clean and is located on the corner of Michigan and Balbo Street in the Loop area of Chicago and is typically a cab ride away from most nightlife on the weekends. There is a lot of self parking nearby if you do not want to pay the $47 valet parking fee or need in and out service. Also try YOLK for breakfast or brunch a few blocks down Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: firebird350
Reviews.Content: I picked a bad weekend to be downtown. The Hawks convention, Bon Jovi concert and the Rock and Roll half marathon all within walking distance of the hotel. The bell staff and valet were awesome with helping with our bags. Walked into this beautiful hotel. Then I had to deal with the staff. I was told I could check in ealry but the person assisting me told me it would be a half hour to an hour before our room was ready. So me and my party went for a walk and came back 1.5 hours later. I was told from a different person at the front desk that check in is not until 4pm and that I will have to wait until then. He totally was talking down to me. I showed him my emails from Marriott that states that I have early check in and if that is not available I will at least have a room by 3pm. He said that was incorrect and did not know who sent the email to me (Even though it clearly shows MARRIOTT). I was not happy and I let him know it. I went out to lunch and then received a call that the room was ready. So I don't know where the miscommunication was. The hotel clearly could not handle a sell out. The room is beautiful. I was spoiled with the bathroom and the halls were very quiet. Room service was another story. They got it wrong and it was cold. DO not order from them until they get their act together. I will definiatley go back there but with all my ducks in a row and paperwork ready to show. It was just a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “historically incredible”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidcustoms
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this amazing hotel for 5 nights with family during late May of 2010 and did not want to leave. Upon arrival we were greeted by staff in the reception and leisurely talked about sports without being rushed or hassled for our bags. The Concierge was very knowledgable about local hot spots and would always seem to be closeby wherever we were in this grand hotel. He recommended to us a highly spoken of deep dish Chicago style pizzeria for which he set us up with a free dessert as well. The hotel itself is a historically registered building and recently underwent a massive renovation, bringing in specialty trades from all around the world. It is conveniently located downtown on Michigan Avenue overlooking the lake and Grant and Millenium parks. The rooms are very nice and include widescreen televisions and incredibly awesome looking bathroom walls. Showering had never been so exciting. I was also blown away by the fitness centre and its amenities. Most hotels have just a few pieces of cardio but this had it all. The clubhouse room on the top floor would open around 5 on weekday afternoons for Marriott card holders where complementary snacks and drinks would be served. This was a definite bonus. We also had breakfast up here most mornings. The one thing that didn't seem to work for me was their Art Gallery which included a long stretch of graffiti style paintings including Al Capone and other various crime themed art, some of which looked very cheap. That and their Al Capone gift shop in the lobby didn't seem to fit in with the hotel itself or what they were all about. I can't wait to go back to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds: A modern, old "grand dame" of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: soflabiztraveller
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a convention across the street at the Hilton and couldn't resist the opportunity to stay at the Blackstone. My background is in hotel and foodservice management and this is a classic hotel. A beautiful, subdued lobby. Courteous front desk and bell staff. Old style elevators with mosaic tile floors (so posh!). It was hot as blazes from typical Chicago summer heat and the air conditioning was going full force and felt like heaven. The room ... large, spacious, well appointed, with that dreamy Marriott-style bed and deep-pile comforter and Egyptian cotton linens. Everything was clean as a whistle. The bathroom was almost as big as the actual room itself. My room faced Grant Park, had a perfect view of the Buckingham Fountain and Lake Michigan. It was magical. I was on a high floor and one night I heard some mild popping noise outside around 9pm. In a few minutes I looked outside and saw the most extraordinary fireworks display over Navy Pier (slightly to the left in my line of sight). It was breathtaking. This is a classic, old-fashioned hotel -- no modern decor, no abstract lighting, no indiscernable images on the walls. I was lured in by the rich woods, gorgeous floors, and ornate chandeliers. Honestly I could live and die here. The restaurant, Mercat, was a little different for a hotel restaurant and bar but exciting and delicious nonetheless. It's tapas-style food and it's done right! Service staff knows their business and knows how to offer warm hospitality. Food was out of this world and reasonably priced. For lunch, they run a special for about $20 where you get 2 courses. Ooh la la. Dinner is a little pricier -- plenty of small plates, actually more than we could eat -- with wine for about $60 per person tax/tip incl. Some of the best food I've enjoyed in a long time. I'm Marriott Platinum Rewards so of course I have concierge lounge privileges which really take the edge off. Plenty of ice cold beverages, a well presented and varied breakfast in the morning, and delicious hors d'oeuvres and desserts at night. Staff in the concierge lounge was excellent. Dining options around the area are adequate. Not abundant ... but you're not going to go hungry, either. Plenty of fast food (Subway, KFC, etc.), a local chicken shack that was quite good, are all within 1 block of the hotel. A few blocks further there are more dining options. I would definitely stay here again and hopefully I'll get that same room. One of the finest hotels I've enjoyed in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: kaisersosa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Blackstone for a two night business trip to Chicago and it was one of the best downtown hotels that I have stayed at in the U.S. in the past couple of years. Renaissance has hit a home run with this gem for business or pleasure. Great staff, clean and well maintained, great location accross from Grant Park and the Lake with reasonable rates. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant renovation!”
Reviews.Author: OmaAnnie
Reviews.Content: A family wedding drew us to the Blackstone for a long weekend. The room was modern with a television in the bathroom mirror! There was a pocket door to the bathroom which didn't give you as much privacy as you might have liked. Our view was of other buildings but if you looked far to the left, you could see Lake Michigan. Other rooms had wonderful views. We were on the floor that required a card to access but it was no different than other floors and created some trouble since other members of our "group" were on other floors and couldn't get to our floor. The reception room was magnificently renovated with beaux art decor. We were in the middle of the city and walked wherever we wanted to go. A really good hotel and time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: agg123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Blackstone for a weeked work-related conference and could not have been more impressed and satisfied. This hotel has a wonderful elegant ambiance. The staff was unfailingly helpful, gracious and polite. The room was well-appointed, the bed extremely comfortable and the bathroom spacious. I loved the shower, which had one of those big square showerheads -- awesome water flow! The fitness center is surprisingly large with lots of cardio and weight machines, medicine balls and an extensive set of free weights (for a hotel fitness center). Mercat a la Plaxa, the restaurant in the lobby, seems like quite a hot spot, with great food (Spanish tapas); breakfast was really good too. And the coffee was amazing! (Am I the only one who hates hotel coffee?? -- I loved the coffee here!). Only one drawback, a minor one for me: no free wifi in the room, and access is a bit pricey at $12.95. I'll never stay anywhere else in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT IN AN HISTORICAL SETTING”
Reviews.Author: oenophil
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located close to Chicago Art Institute and Grant Park, and other museums and attractions. Our room was very comfortable and I loved the starched sheets on the bed. Bathroom was large, well-equipped and very pleasant. Gym - sports facility is very well-equipped and modern with a lovely view towards the lake. Staff was helpful. WE really enjoyed this hotel. I loved this hotel but lamented the lack of good restaurants in the vicinity. Perhaps we should have tried the Tapas restaurant in the hotel, which has an excellent and eclectic list of Spanish wines. We felt that almost all the food we were exposed to in Chicago had added sugar and/or salt (much more than we are used to) and the portion sizes were far too big (twice as much as a normal person should eat).. Despite all the condominiums in the area, there did not appear to be any stores providiing fresh fruit and vegetables. I don't know what people eat.

Reviews.Title: “Fun atmosphere/Great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Sleep_NH
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel on South Michigan Ave. Not my favorite location....shopping on Michigan Ave is further north, but the actual hotel and rooms make up for it. I was in a corner room, so I had plenty of light and a nice view of the city. I have to say that my favorite part of the room (other than the great Renaissance bedding) was the bathroom. The only way I can describe it is "sexy". Stand up glass shower with a rain shower head, great lighting and very contemporary/fun black and white wall vinyl. I didn't interact with the staff much, but those that I did were friendly and professional. Starbucks in the lower lobby is a great perk. Overall a fun hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Convenient to Michgan Avenue and Taste of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: renosparksVP
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Loop for business at McCormick Place Convention Center. While the Blackstone is about a 30 minute walk, it is only a 10 minute bus ride on CTA. Buses run frequently, and getting around is a breeze. Our room faced North on the 19th floor, and was very quiet, although you can hear noises from the hallway. For visiting events and sights in Grant Park like Taste of Chicago and Shedd Aquarium, it's all in reasonable walking distance. The Windy City has great paths and bike lanes, so bring your walking shoes, or rent a bike nearby. Obviously, these recommendations are for the warmer months, and our stay happened to be over three days of perfect weather! Our friends who came in a few days earlier said it had been rainy with a few thunderstorms before our arrival. Be prepared for all kinds of weather. The fitness center is small with a few machines. And there are not that many other amenities. Basically, this is a comfortable and clean hotel, a little on the spendy side, that will be a good place to rest your head. There aren't that many restaurants in the surrounding area, but you can find more places to eat as you travel North on Michigan Avenue. The dining in Shedd, etc is actually quite decent, but expect to pay attraction prices.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from rooms by elevator”
Reviews.Author: VDJTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. Good location for going to museums, Grant & Millineum Parks. Other sights are a bit further away but convenient to red line CTA station. Room on 22nd floor on North side of building - okay view of city but not spectacular. Mirror TV in bathroom was a novelty but did not get as many channels as regular TV. Fiancee hated the rain shower in the bathroom - he's used to a shower with a lot more water pressure. Room was just to the left after getting off elevator - could hear the mechanics of the elevator operating which was irritating. Fitness center was very impressive and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.....Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: na07950
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a trip to Chicago and, for the business portion, stayed at the Blackstone. As previous travelers have noted, the hotel is beautifully renovated. My room was a good sized, had a very comfortable bed, and I loved the Aveda toiletries. The bellmen and front desk staff were very friendly and helpful (one even helped me solve a problem with my blackberry). The challenges for the hotel are the large number of steps just to get into the lobby (good to know if you have a problem with this) and the area. The front desk described it as up and coming. This basically translated into a lack of places near by where you'd want to eat (since there are several colleges, there are a number of college type dining places) and really no shopping nearby (so if you need something at CVS/Walgreens, you'll have a bit of a walk).

Reviews.Title: “Does not work for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: NYCilley02
Reviews.Content: The Blackstone is a classic hotel that has been recently renovated and reopened under the management of Marriott. The renovation was extremely well done, and the result is a hotel that is elegant with many quirky design touches. I've given the hotel a relatively low score only because of some downright bizarre service lapses and policies, which could be easily remedied. After having stayed at the hotel on three occasions over the past few months, I've decided that these are just unforgivable. I'll start with the good and then move on to the bad... Rooms are top notch - they are elegantly decorated and are equipped with all modern conveniences. Bathrooms are spacious, covered with white marble, have rain showers, good water pressure and TV's integrated into the mirrors. The climate control works very well (something I wish all hotels paid a bit more attention to). Beds are the standard Renaissance beds, which are excellent (better than Westin Heavenly Beds, in my opinion). They tend to be a bit small, but that is common for older hotels like this. The gym is also excellent. It is large and is well equipped with tons of cardio equipment, free weights and a full set of machines (no fewer than 10). Service is friendly and professional. The staff really couldn't be nicer and more eager to help. My big problem is around the hotel's lack of dining options. It seems that they have outsourced all in-room dining to an unaffiliated on-site restaurant and are thus limited by that restaurant's hours. This means that there is no room service between 11am and 5pm and after 11pm. This means that, if you are a business traveler and you arrive at the hotel after a long day of travel or a late night at the office, there is literally no place to get a bite to eat or a drink after 11pm. Mercat's food is pretty good, which is great if you only eat meals during breakfast and normal dinner hours. Unfortunately most business travelers I know have less predictable and conventional schedules than that, and often have a food craving after 11pm. This is why most hotels of this caliber have 24 hour room service. The lack of room service for 54% of the day would be forgivable if the hotel had minibars, but management seems to have made the bizarre decision to forgo minibars. I've noticed a trend among 4* hotels away from minibars, but most hotels that go that route offer guests 24 hour room service as an alternative. Not this one. Just to recap, this means that, should your flight be delayed and you arrive at the hotel after 11pm absolutely starving, you are just [--] out of luck. (This happened to me during 2 of my 3 stays here). You can get dressed, climb out of bed and start trudging the streets, but there is absolutely nothing in the hotels immediate vicinity. Feel a hankering for a drink after a tough day of meetings? Sorry! You can't even buy a beer at the small shop in the lobby. Blackstone management: this is why most hotels have bars, room service, restaurants and minibars - to serve their guests needs. After 11pm, your hotel has none of those. Nada. I understand that you made the decision to outsource your hotel dining to Mercat, which admittedly has better food than most hotel restaurants. In that case YOU MUST STOCK YOUR GUEST ROOMS WITH SNACKS AND DRINKS. A few other quibbles: - I called down asking for a fork and knife to be brought up and was informed that there is a $12.50 fee for the delivery of "non-food items." What?! I've heard of nickel and diming, but this is truly insane. What are you thinking? - Rooms do not have wine glasses or corkscrews in them. This would be fine if this was your way of gently nudging guests to order room service, but, as I discussed above, your hotel doesn't have that for 54% of the day. - As far as I can tell there are zero benefits for Marriott Platinum members. Most hotels give some sort of room upgrade, but its hard to imagine that my rooms could have been any smaller. Was that just oversight on the part of the check in staff or is that the hotel's official policy? - The lounge is very nice, but keeps extremely limited hours. I don't know exactly what they are, because, during my multiple stays here I only encountered it being open once. It was closed basically at all other times. Maybe this is a cutback because of the recession? - The hotel doesn't seem to have bellmen. (Or if they do, they only staff them during the absolute middle of the day when no business traveler would be arriving or departing). This means that, if you arrive in the evening with a ton of luggage, you get to haul them up the two flights of stairs into the lobby all on your own. Maybe this is also a cutback due to the recession? - Once I forgot to bring toothpaste. Not only did the hotel's housekeeping have none in stock, but they don't even sell basic toiletries in the lobby shop. Since I arrived in the evening, after CVS had closed, I just had to forgo brushing my teeth. This is really not acceptable for a hotel in this category. Basically, in conclusion, I am extremely frustrated by the Blackstone. They have a great physical plant (beautiful old building, exquisitely decorated rooms and public spaces, a top notch gym). Their staff are outstanding. They just need to invest a bit more in their offering of services in order to become a hotel that is at all realistic for business travelers. They are so close, yet so far! Leisure travelers who intend to take their meals outside the hotel, be in bed by 11, and have no Marriott status should be very happy here. (Just don't expect to be able to eat breakfast in the lounge on weekends. Or grab a coke there during just about any other time, since it will be locked.)

Reviews.Title: “Stellar”
Reviews.Author: Zoezer
Reviews.Content: I was at a conference at the Hilton across the street, and couldn't be happier that I chose the Blackstone instead of a big impersonal conference hotel. The decor is beautiful, preserving the history of the place while bringing it into the 21st century. Loved the art floor! I opted for a deluxe lake view room which was very spacious and comfortable with a lovely park and lake view. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and problems were dealt with immediately. The restaurant was very good. The Bongo Room nearby was excellent for brunch, also liked Lou Malnati's for pizza. My favorite hotel so far in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBD
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here after an event. The room was extremely elegant and the bed very comfortable. Security was prompt in making other guests be quiet after I complained of noise and then it was very quiet and I slept well. There was only a very large shower in the bathroom, not a tub, but this was not a problem for me. It's well located for all sightseeing. Doormen were extremely helpful and solicitous and staff very friendly. Breakfast was good. It is a very smart and elegant hotel which was pleasant to stay in but only one night did not allow me to explore all its amenities. I would definitely choose to stay there again. A super plus was that the toiletries were by Aveda, not the usual yukky stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Very swanky.”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadedGidget
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference. Rooms are modern, not very spacious but we weren't there much. Convenient to grant park and the museum complex. On site restaurant is very nice but pricey. Try it at lunch for a more affordable meal. Only 3 blocks away from a Red line station. Parking is very expensive and is valet only.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cfischer
Reviews.Content: Great stay at a fabulous hotel! We got an outstanding price @ $75 per night and as a MR Gold member I was upgraded to a concierge level corner room! Check-in was a quick and professional and we were on our way to the room in a few minutes (checking in 2 hours before check-in time). The room was furnished in modern decors and the bed was perfect. Everything was clean, modern and working. Another highlight is the concierge lounge on the top floor which featured a good selection of hot and cold snacks in the evening as well a breakfast selection (which was a bit on the small side). We'll definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: lov2cnewplcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blackstone March 20-22 for the Shamrock Shuffle. This hotel was the perfect locattion for the race as the park & starting point were right across the street though it is further from other attractions. The service was great and we took the hotel's advice on two places to eat and they were great!

Reviews.Title: “A Unique, Fun, and Classy Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mom2amywill
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent the weekend in Chicago and thoroughly enjoyed the Blackstone. It is both funky and beautiful all at the same time. We also appreciate the all of the history that has happened here. The check-in was efficient and pleasant, with excellent service throughout our stay. The doormen always greeted us as we had lived there forever. We enjoyed being walking distance to Millennium Park and the Art Institute of Chicago (and it was free on Thursday evenings--helpful hint to fellow tourists). We also highly recommend The Gage for dinner, across from Milennium Park after you check out the art. Also, grab some breakfast at Yolk, a few blocks south on Michigan. It was delicious and very reasonable. Back at the Blackstone, the beds were excellent and I was very pleased to have Aveda amenities. I would most definitely stay at the Blackstone again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice luxurious hotel”
